The prestress force exerted by the bending wire or strip is added to the force exerted in the event of a crash, and if the sum of these forces exceeds a limit value, the break-away connection is released. The dislocation of the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis in the direction toward the vehicle front can then commence.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sulky with two wheels, individually fastened to a common frame, designed for trotting races. The sulky has a lightweight construction, is easy-running, and strongly built to endure strain during exercise and competitions. The invention aims to provide a new sulky construction that can be manufactured from light metal and other lightweight yet durable materials.

• Conventional sulkies have been made from welded steel constructions, which provide a lightweight yet strong structure. However, attempts to build sulkies from aluminum have been unsuccessful due to poor strength qualities. The conventional design requires welding, which is difficult with aluminum and other light metals.

• The present invention provides a sulky with a stable construction, where the shafts and crossbar transfer the load to the wheel planes only. The sulky can be assembled easily by the user from substantially flat elements, requiring only a small space during storage and transportation. The elements can be easily dispatched in a flat package.

• The sulky is built from inexpensive semi-produced components, such as casted elements and extruded profiles. The end frames are casted, preferably from aluminum or a similar light metal, using a chill-casting or press-casting process. The crossbar is manufactured from extruded aluminum or a similar light metal.

• The wheels are fastened to the end frames by conventional fastening techniques, and the shafts are fastened by horizontally arranged fastening bolts and screws. The driver's seat is fastened to the crossbar by extruded brackets, which can be clamped using conventional clamping devices. The crossbar is designed as an extruded aluminum profile with internal extending protrusions.

• The crossbar is fastened to the mounting bushing using through screws, which allow for easy introduction of the extruded profile with suitable play. The materials have flexibility and deformability, allowing the extruded profile and mounting bushing to be pulled together when the screws are tightened. The surfaces of the crossbar and mounting bushing are deformed, providing an exact adaptation.

• The end frame has a design that allows it to be cast in a tool with only one core and two side walls. The core can be pulled out vertically, and the side elements can be bent out to slip the casted element. The inside and outside of the mounting bushing are formed in contact with the side elements.

• The complete sulky can be packed into a flat box for storing and transportation, and the user can assemble the parts themselves in a quarter of an hour

<summary>
• The present invention is a continuation-in-part of two previous applications, Ser. No. 172,806 and Ser. No. 031,752, both of which are now abandoned. The invention relates to a process for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of motor vehicles.

• The conventional process of installing curved glass panels involves pre-contouring and tempering the glass, which can cause distortion, brittleness, and increased cost. The present invention aims to overcome these disadvantages by using flat, uncurved glass panels.

• The invention provides a method for utilizing flat glass panels to form curved windows in vehicles, which is more cost-effective and efficient. The process involves flexing the flat glass panel to conform to the curved window bay.

• The flexed glass panel is then secured in place using a holding means, such as resilient clips and reveal molding, which maintains the glass in its curved shape. The holding means is designed to engage and maintain the flat glass in the curved window opening.

• The invention also involves applying a weather sealant and adhesive compound in situ along the confronting edges of the window panel. The adhesive is allowed to cure until the panel becomes fixed permanently in the window opening in its conforming curvature.

• The fastening means comprises a plurality of resilient clips uniformly spaced about the perimeter of the window bay and a reveal molding cooperatively secured to the clips. The reveal molding is provided with a resilient bias, pressing on the outer surface of the glass panel.

• The reveal molding is designed to snap onto the leaf part of each clip, holding it firmly in place, and urging the molding inwardly and downwardly into the window bay. The lower end of the molding engages and presses onto the face of the glass panel, maintaining its flexure.

• The permanent mounting of the glass panel is achieved using a curable adhesive sealant, which is inserted in the compartment between the panel and the frame. The adhesive sealant is preferably polysulfide, with suitable fillers and solvents added thereto.

• The invention also contemplates the placement of a continuously extending dam of elastic material, which acts as a closure for the continuous bead of adhesive sealant. The dam lodges along the inner wall of the frame, adjacent the periphery of the window bay, in contact with the inner surface of the glass panel.

• The present invention provides a cost-effective and efficient method for installing curved glass panels in vehicles, which overcomes the disadvantages of the conventional process. The invention is suitable for use in

<summary>
* The present invention is an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles that employs an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension. The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel, and its cooperation can be achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel. This system aims to provide an anti-lock brake system having anti-dive characteristics.
* The anti-dive unit controls the contracting action of the telescopic front fork in accordance with the operation of the front wheel brake, suppressing the contracting action of the front fork to quickly increase the grounding load on the front wheel every time the hydraulic braking pressure for the front wheel brake is increased by an anti-lock control unit. This suppresses vertical vibration of the chassis, facilitates front wheel braking, and minimizes variations in the angular deceleration of the front wheel, ultimately improving braking efficiency. The system is designed to work in conjunction with the anti-lock control unit to optimize braking performance.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a gate valve used for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances such as sauces, salad dressings, and catsup from flexible bags or pouches.
• The valve is designed to be operated with one hand, allowing the other hand to hold a receiving vessel, and is particularly useful in fast-food restaurants.
• The valve assembly consists of a spout insert mounting sleeve, a gate valve guide member, and a gate valve member that can be reciprocated to control the flow of the substance.
• The gate valve member is curved complementally to the guide member, allowing it to be drawn into sealing engagement with the outlet as it moves over it.
• The valve can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily, and can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position.
• The valve can be actuated with one hand only, and the movement of the gate can be gradual or quick, allowing for variable flow or complete cut-off.
• The valve assembly can be mounted on the spout of a bag, which can be supported in a dispenser, and can be locked in a downwardly-inclined position to ensure all contents flow from the bag.
• The valve is designed to provide an effective seal when closed, and to be completely unobstructed when opened, allowing for smooth and controlled dispensing of the substance.
• The invention provides a significant improvement over prior art valves, which were not disassemblable for cleaning and allowed for residue accumulation.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output of a vehicle control, allowing the same system to be used with various types of vehicles with minimal modifications. The system includes a variable reflective element that assumes a partial reflectance level in response to a drive signal, and a mirror control that is responsive to the output of the vehicle control for generating at least one mirror control output. The mirror control determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control by monitoring the output and attempting to conclude a state of the output. This allows the system to adapt to different protocols, such as reverse-gear indication signals, without requiring hardware changes.

• The mirror control may include a microcomputer with software that determines the protocol by software processing, and may monitor the output of the vehicle control upon starting or running of the vehicle. The system may also include at least one light sensor, and the mirror control may establish a value for the drive signal in response to an output of the at least one light sensor. The microcomputer may maintain parameters such as "reverse-inhibit-running average" and "reverse-inhibit-ignition-cycle average" to track the protocol of the output over time. By using a software-based approach, the invention reduces hardware expenses and can be implemented using existing microcomputers in the vehicle mirror control system.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pallet systems that facilitate loading and unloading, and limit the shifting of loaded items. The pallet system includes a pallet having at least one pair of parallel guide rails raised above a top surface of the pallet, each pair of guide rails configured to be straddled by side supports of a tray.
* The pallet system includes at least one end stop on the top surface of the pallet, each end stop positioned to limit longitudinal movement of a tray loaded on the pallet. The pallet system also includes two end plates, configured to be vertically positioned at edges of the pallet at ends of the guide rails.
* The pallet system provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped, and allows trays to be slid on and off, making it suitable for automated loading and unloading of the trays. The pallet system restricts both the lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet.
* The components of the pallet system may be made of various materials, such as plastic, and can be manufactured by a variety of methods, including thermo forming, rotomolding, and injection molding. The pallet system can be customized for its intended load, with features such as the size and shape of the guide rails and end plates being tailored to specific types of trays and loads.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners of the all polymeric type, providing effective grounding without the use of conductive plates, clips, or shunts. The liner material used has similar mechanical properties to the liner disclosed in Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951, but has improved electrical properties. The disclosures in Wulff U.S. Pat. No. 4,241,667 and Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951 are incorporated by reference.

• The liner is composed of a base ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material with a conductive material additive, preferably 2.0% carbon black. The conductive material can be added as a particulate to UHMW-PE in particulate or powder form and then heated under mold pressure for thermoforming. Other plastics, molding methods, or conductive materials may also be used.

• The liner has all the benefits of the Chierici et al patent, including self-lubricating properties, and is also conductive, eliminating the need for additional grounding apparatus. The liner is designed to withstand loads imposed by cars having a mass bearing on each center bowl, and its properties are optimized for both chemical and mechanical areas. The liner's conductivity increases under load, making it more effective when the car is fully loaded.

• The liner's configuration is designed to fit in the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate, limiting lost motion movement and providing vertical support. The liner's UHMW-PE material resists distension or stretching and disperses loads, making it highly resilient. The liner also has beneficial self-lubricating properties, as described in the cited patents.

• The liner forms two slip surfaces with the center plate assembly, ensuring the needed swiveling action of the car trucks with respect to the car body. The primary slip surface is between the upper surface of the liner and the body bolster center plate's lower surface. The liner also forms a secondary contingency slip surface between the lower surface of the liner and the truck bolster floor.

• The liner can meet both the coefficient of friction and electrical conductivity standards, making it an improvement over both the all UHMW-PE liner and the clip or shunt grounded version. The liner's coefficient of friction under load can temporarily be higher, but it still meets the required standards. The invention is

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system.
* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, which includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in the space restricted by the electromotive ring, the magnetic suspension shaft, and the magnetic suspension guide rail, and go around the magnetic suspension shaft under an electromagnetic thrust.
* The invention also includes two improvement solutions, coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings, which can overcome the reactive torque of the rotary wings and improve the power performance of the flying saucer.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to streptavidin muteins, which are modified forms of streptavidin, a protein that binds to biotin with high affinity. These muteins have been engineered to have a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands, making them useful for various applications such as protein purification and detection.

• The streptavidin muteins of the invention are characterized by at least one mutation in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, which results in a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands compared to wild-type streptavidin. The muteins can be used in various formats, including as a labelled protein or immobilized on a solid phase.

• The invention also provides a process for the production of streptavidin muteins, which involves transforming a host cell with a vector containing a nucleic acid coding for the mutein, culturing the host cell, and isolating the mutein. The streptavidin muteins of the invention have various applications, including protein purification, detection, and immobilization.</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to movable partitions and panels used to separate or insulate cargo during transportation or storage, particularly in multi-temperature transport. The invention aims to improve the efficiency of refrigerated trailers, railcars, and containers by dividing the cargo space into sections of varying sizes. This allows for the transportation of perishable items at different temperatures within the same trailer or container. The invention also reduces unnecessary strain and wear on the refrigeration unit, increases fuel consumption, and raises transportation costs.

* The invention includes an improved partition system with at least two panels independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies, allowing each panel to be moved independently. In a preferred embodiment, two bulkheads or panels are slidably attached to separate pairs of ceiling-mounted rails in a refrigerated trailer. Each bulkhead or panel can be independently slid toward the front or rear of the trailer to define different cargo areas to be maintained at different temperatures. This configuration enables the transportation of cargo at different temperatures within the same trailer.

* The panels are slidably attached to the rails with a trolley assembly, which permits the panels to be moved in the fore and aft direction and to be raised like garage doors and secured to the ceiling when not in use. The trolley assemblies consist of hinge plates fixedly secured to the panels, a hinge rod, and trolleys that serve to suspend the panel from the rails. The trolleys include rollers that permit the bulkhead to be slid into a desired longitudinal position. The hinge mechanism permits the panel to rotate about the hinge rod.

* The rail system comprises longitudinal rails having an internal channel adapted to receive a slidable member, preferably a roller. End rails provide a mount for the ends of the longitudinal rails and also function as a trolley stop. Fixed to the end rails are lift mechanisms and safety chains, the functionality of which is described below. Mounting flanges permit the rails to be fastened to the trailer walls or ceiling with standard fasteners.

* The panels can be moved from the position shown in FIG. 3 to the position shown in FIG. 4 by lifting the bottom of the panel up and to the rear of the trailer. The panel is moved fore or aft, as needed, to position the base of the panel proximate to the strap having a hook. The hook is secured to the base of the panel, preferably by attachment to a cooperating receptacle. The strap is pulled downward to raise the base of the panel to the ceiling of the trailer.

* The strap and cooperating

<summary>
• The invention relates to a novel sanitizable rotary valve used in conjunction with liquid chromatographic columns and sanitary liquid handling systems to separate and/or purify biological macromolecules. The valve is designed to provide a means for sanitizing the contact faces of the rotor and stator surfaces without disassembling the valve. The invention combines elements previously found in the valve art with the unique feature of partial separation of the rotor-stator faces to allow flushing across the process fluid-contacting surfaces. This design allows for the unique sanitary operation of the valve, enabling sanitization in place (SIP) without disassembling the valve.

• The valve features a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm integrally molded to form the multiple sealing ports of the rotor face. The diaphragm has a plurality of rotor port sealing means and at least one diaphragm-integral dynamic wipe sealing lip. The diaphragm is fashioned as an integral insert molded part of the base of the rotor body. Suitable materials for the diaphragm include thermoplastic elastomers such as styrene-ethylene/butylene-styrene block copolymers.

• The valve also features a stator having a body with an inner surface that is a rotor-facing surface. The stator body has at least a pair of first and second connection ports in fluid communication with stator ports located on the rotor-facing surface. The stator ports are fluidly connected to their respective connection ports. Means for at least one SIP/barrier gutter are located on an inner surface of the valve. Orthogonal actuating means are provided for incrementally adjusting the rotor perpendicular to its direction of linear motion.

• The invention is also directed to a multi-port sliding valve of the type having a linear slider, a stator having a plurality of connection ports and associated channels in liquid communication with external fluid sources and separation means. The improvement comprises a sealing means comprising a diaphragm, the diaphragm having at least one slider port sealing means. At least one connection port is capable of being in fluid communication with a source of SIP fluid, and ports comprising channels through the stator body fluidly connected to their respective connection ports.

• The primary object of the present invention is to provide a sanitizable slider valve in which the port-sealing faces of the slider and stator may be intermittently flushed and cleaned, while maintaining the sterile condition of the process system. Another object of the invention is to provide a slider valve having a fluid barrier stream which continually purges the external

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. The assembly reduces variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure and is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain. It is also lightweight and portable.

* The assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor, a fluid regulator, and a generator. The vane motor converts pressurized fluid into mechanical power, which is then converted into rotational or electrical energy. The generator is coupled to the vane motor and produces electricity.

* The fluid regulator is coupled to the vane motor and reduces the pressure of the fluid before it exits the assembly. The regulator is preferably of the type known in the art and is constructed of steel. It defines a high-pressure cavity and a low-pressure cavity that are in fluid communication with each other.

* The vane motor is preferably a vane motor, although it may be any suitable device for translating fluid pressure into mechanical motion. The motor is provided with a drive shaft and a casing that defines a fluid inlet and a fluid outlet. The casing is provided with a hollow interior that is in fluid communication with the inlet and outlet.

* As fluid enters the fluid inlet under pressure, it presses against the vanes, forcing the inner drum into a counterclockwise rotation. The vanes extend and retract relative to the inner drum, reducing the drag coefficient when near the ceiling and increasing it as they approach the abrasion plate. The fluid exhausts through the fluid outlet as the vanes move past the abrasion plate.

* In an alternative embodiment, a high-pressure fluid source is coupled to a first vane motor, which is coupled to a second vane motor. The second vane motor is coupled to a regulator and an output line, and the first vane motor is coupled to a generator. The generator is coupled to a battery, and the second vane motor is coupled to a pulley and a belt that drives an axle.

* The assembly can be used in various applications, including a gas grill, a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus, and a vehicle driven by a pressurized flammable fluid. The vane motor can be used to generate electricity or mechanical work, and any number of motors and generators can be used in conjunction with any number of regulators. The motor and generator can be of any desired dimensions and design to accommodate any desired pressures.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies, particularly an improved tray valve assembly for a process column. The improvement comprises a plurality of apertures formed in the tray having a valve cover mounted thereon. The valve cover is mounted by first and second legs, the first leg being disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray and being wider than the second leg. The legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions thereof for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow.

* The invention includes the above-described tray valve being formed of a round disc having the first and second legs depending downwardly therefrom. Each of the legs are formed with outwardly extending flange portions for underlying the tray and locking the disc in a floating relationship relative thereto. The valve aperture is circular in shape and the valve legs are disposed in slotted regions disposed outwardly of the circular aperture to prevent the rotation of the valve plate for maintaining the orientation of the valve leg relative to the tray. The biasing means comprises a detent portion formed on the cover of the valve for preventing the surface thereof from resting flush against the tray surface.

* The present invention provides a method of and apparatus for enhanced vapor liquid flow manifesting increased efficiency with a directional thrust valve assembly. Such a valve tray assembly is provided by the present invention wherein a circular tray valve is supported by first and second support legs, oriented into the liquid flow of the tray with the first leg having a wider surface area presented to the flow for diverting the flow therearound. The width of the first leg is substantially less than the diameter of the circular valve aperture, about which the liquid is induced to flow into engagement with the vapor passing therethrough. The valve assembly, when used in conjunction with, and outwardly of, a raised active inlet area further controls initially directed liquid flow from the active inlet area beneath the downcomer.

* The invention includes an improved method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer of a process column onto an underlying cross-flow tray with the column having a plurality of trays and downcomers spaced vertically one from the other. The improvement comprises forming the tray with a plurality of directional thrust valves disposed therein, the valves being formed of generally circular disc members disposed above circular apertures formed within the tray. The disc members have first and second legs in support thereof, the first leg being wider than said second leg for directing flow therearound. The step of forming the

<summary>
• The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with a thickness of 10-350 μm, comprising at least one white pigment, one UV absorber, and one flame retardant.
• The film has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively, making it suitable for various applications such as interior decoration, exhibition stands, and protective glazing.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus and a method for continuously electrolytic coloring of strips or wires of aluminum or aluminum base alloys.
* The conventional method of continuously coloring the anodic coating of aluminum strips or wires has defects, such as poor weatherability and fading over time.
* The present invention provides an apparatus and a method for continuously conducting an anodic oxidation and an electrolytic coloring of an aluminum strip or wire without needing a large amount of electrical energy.
* The apparatus comprises a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, an electric circuit, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire continuously and successively through the baths.
* The anodic oxidation bath composition used in this invention is usually an aqueous solution of 10 to 55% sulfuric acid, and the thickness of the oxide film formed on an aluminum strip or wire should be thicker than 4 microns.
* The electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid, and the bath composition is selected suitably depending on the desired color.
* The aluminum strip or wire is rendered capable of functioning as a cathode indirectly by the action of the electrode disposed in the bath and is electrolyzed by direct current in the bath.
* The current density and the electrolytic period of time in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire immersed, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion of the aluminum strip or wire.
* The apparatus of this invention can produce continuously and with a low cost aluminum strips or wires having colored oxide films or layers thereon superior in weatherability or fade resistance.
* The invention has a high industrial value due to its ability to produce high-quality aluminum strips or wires with excellent weatherability and fade resistance.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, and methods for preparing them. These polymers can be used to form a layer that prevents the reflection of light from lower layers coated on a semiconductor chip when photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources are employed. The polymers of the present invention are designed to facilitate light absorption at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm by having groups that absorb light strongly at both wavelengths. The polymers can be prepared by reacting polyhydroxystyrene resin, poly(styrene-acrylate) resin, or novolac resin with diazonaphthoquinone halide in a solvent in the presence of an amine.

* The anti-reflective coating composition of the present invention may comprise one of the polymers alone or in combination with a light-absorbing compound selected from the group consisting of anthracene and its derivatives, fluorenone derivatives, fluorene and its derivatives, fluorenol, xanthone, quinazarin, and fluorescein. The anti-reflective coating composition is prepared by dissolving a polymer in an organic solvent and subsequently adding one or more light-absorbing compounds. The anti-reflective coating of the present invention can be provided on a semiconductor silicon wafer by filtering a solution of the polymer or composition, coating the filtered solution on a wafer, and hard-baking the coating to cross-link the anti-reflective coating polymer. The polymers and compositions of the present invention have proven to be excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials during the formation of submicro-patterns in photolithographic processes.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines utilizing nickel catalysts, specifically nickel in the zero oxidation state. Suitable Ni(0) catalysts are derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina. The nickel catalysts are relatively inexpensive and can be reused after the guanylation reactions. The reactions are carried out at a temperature of from about -30-140° C., and preferably at room temperature or under ambient conditions.

• The guanylating agents used in the invention are thioureas and isothioureas, which have specific general formulas. At least one of the R groups should be a protecting group, and preferred protecting groups include Boc groups, Cbz groups, and arylsulfonyl groups. The protecting groups can be readily removed from the resulting guanidine using conventional methods. The location of the particular protecting group(s) can be selected depending upon the desired final substituted guanidine.

• The methods of the invention comprise reacting a compound having a specific structure with an amine or pyrrolidine in the presence of a nickel catalyst. The reactions are preferably carried out in a solvent system, and suitable solvent systems include DMF, THF, DMSO, and water mixed with any of the foregoing. The reactions result in a percent yield of at least about 10%, preferably at least about 40%, and more preferably at least about 85%. The reaction times vary depending on the specific reaction conditions.

• The invention also includes the synthesis of N-tosyl and N-mtr protected guanidines, which are prepared by reacting N-arylsulfonyl-S-methylisothiourea with an amine in the presence of a nickel catalyst. The reactions are carried out in DMF and result in high yields of the corresponding guanidines. The guanylation of aromatic amines with N,N'-diphenyl-S-methylisothiourea is also described, and the reactions result in high yields of the corresponding guanidines.

• The examples provided demonstrate the effectiveness of the nickel catalysts in the guanylation reactions. The results show that the nickel(0) derived from the nickel-boride acts as a catalyst during the guanylation reactions, and that various nickel catalysts can be used to achieve high yields of the corresponding guanidines. The reactions

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom, where air under pressure is ejected to produce different weft carrying forces suited for the respective weft threads.
• The invention achieves this by ejecting air under different pressures or supplying air under pressure for different intervals of time, allowing weft threads to be inserted and carried through the warp shed under stable conditions in a constant period of time.
• Various embodiments of the invention are described, including the use of subnozzles with different orifice diameters, regulators to supply air under different pressures, and remotely controlled pressure regulator valves.
• The invention is applicable to air jet looms using more than two different weft threads and can be modified to incorporate different piping systems and control systems for the main nozzle and subnozzles.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, and a process of making thereof, which involves twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres.
* The process involves health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, drawing the carded health preserved bast fibres into bast fibre strips, health preserving the bast fibre strips, and spinning the health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn.
* The invention has the advantages of improving the flexibility of bast fibres, reducing the end breakage rate, and improving work efficiency and quality of products, with the end breakage rate reduced to 150-200 times per hour for each machine when the yarn is 12 s in fineness.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome, a process of screening nucleotide sequences for a desired phenotype in plants, and transgenic plants and libraries of plants or plant seeds obtained or obtainable according to the processes of the invention. The invention also relates to vectors for these processes and to plants or plant cells transformed therewith. The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors that are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination. The recombination product contains a DNA sequence of interest that is capable of expressing a function of interest.

* The invention provides a process of producing transgenic plants or plant cells that are stably transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, whereby said DNA sequence of interest derives from at least two different vectors. The process allows for the screening of DNA libraries for desired functions in plants and the creation of stable transformants. The process also enables the production of transgenic plants or plant cells that contain different DNA sequences of interest, each of which is assembled from two different vectors. The DNA sequence of interest may contain three or more sequence portions of three or more different vectors.

* The process of the invention allows for the assembly of complex DNA sequences of interest in planta from smaller precursors, which can be used for introducing a gene to be expressed in a chromosome of a plant cell or plant. The process can also be used for screening libraries of coding or regulatory sequences of interest. The invention provides transgenic plants or parts thereof, like seeds, produced by the process of the invention, and libraries of plants, of plant cells, or of plant seeds obtained or obtainable according to the process of the invention. The process can be used for many different purposes, including gene function determination, functional genomics, and directed evolution.

* The invention is preferably carried out with higher, multi-cellular plants, with preference given to agronomically and horticulturally important species. Common crop plants for the use in present invention include alfalfa, barley, beans, canola, cowpeas, cotton, corn, clover, lotus, lentils, lupine, millet, oats, peas, peanuts, rice, rye, sweet clover, sunflower, sweetpea, soybean, sorghum triticale, yam beans, velvet beans, vetch, wheat, wisteria, and nut plants. The plant species preferred for practicing of this invention are including but not restricted to: Representatives

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing a refrigerant gas by rotating a swash plate. The invention aims to improve swash plate compressors by applying a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate facial surfaces and ends to reduce frictional wear on the components. The coated swash plate can be made from lower-cost alloy materials while maintaining durability and efficiency. This is particularly useful in automotive air conditioning systems.

* Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning systems for many years. In a swash plate type compressor, a swash plate rotates about a shaft, and a number of pistons are arranged radially about the perimeter of the swash plate. The facial and end surfaces of the swash plate contact pivoting shoes within the pistons, causing a shear-type contact that leads to friction and wear. The interfacial surfaces between the swash plate and pistons are subject to high load conditions and are susceptible to premature wear.

* It is known to coat the surface of an aluminum swash plate to reduce wear, but existing coatings have several disadvantages. Electroplated metal matrix coatings on aluminum components are acceptable under light loads but have several disadvantages when used under high friction loads. These disadvantages include the need for expensive, high-silicon aluminum base materials, high surface finishing for the base material, and a complex electroplating process. Adding fluororesin to the metal matrix improves the coefficient of friction but at the expense of surface hardness and durability.

* The present invention provides a coating on a swash plate that is both friction-reducing and highly durable. The coating permits the use of lower-cost, low-silicon aluminum base material for the swash plate and does not require electroplating the surface of the swash plate. The coating is applied to the swash plate in an aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature. The swash plate facial surfaces, together with the end surface, may be simultaneously coated.

* The coating comprises a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load-bearing additive. The polyfluoro elastomer is dissolved in either a water base or hydrocarbon solution and is selected from a class of materials that will form highly cross-linked long-chain polymers. Especially preferred are polyfluoro elastomers of polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE). The PTFE cross-linking occurs at an elevated temperature and produces a highly adherent coating with high load-bearing and

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having a specific formula, using hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce unwanted impurities. This process is particularly useful for synthesizing pyrazolotriazoles, which are used as magenta couplers in photographic products.

• The traditional method of desulfurization involves a two-step process, including a ring contraction reaction and hydrolysis with hydrochloric acid, which generates elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities. These impurities can interfere with subsequent reaction steps and are detrimental to photographic systems.

• The improved process uses hypophosphorous acid in the deacylation and desulfurization step, which reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed. This results in a higher yield of the desired product and a more straightforward process.

• The process involves reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the desired pyrazolotriazole. The reaction conditions, such as temperature and pressure, can be adjusted to optimize the process.

• The invention provides several advantages, including the formation of H2S by-product instead of sulfur, which is readily removed from the reaction zone. Additionally, hypophosphorous acid does not reduce nitro groups or affect other functional groups in the molecule.

• The process is adaptable to industry and can be used to synthesize a wide range of pyrazolotriazoles with different substituents, as long as they meet certain criteria. The substituents can be selected based on their properties and the desired utility of the final product.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric. The yarns in the various layers are held together by stitching, loose knitting, or adhesive bonding. This type of fabric is particularly useful for structural parts in high-speed airplanes.

• The prior art has not shown a process or apparatus that allows fully parallel courses of bias laid, non-woven fabrics to be placed on moving conveyors with partial overlapping of return courses. The present invention addresses this limitation by using a rake mechanism synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism. This allows for greater assurance of parallelism of the yarns.

• The rake mechanism is associated with the needles formed on the conveyors and allows successive courses of yarn to overlie a portion of an already laid course. The overlying portions are parallel to the first courses, and the amount of overlap can be controlled to achieve the desired density and uniformity. The rake mechanism can move a distance equivalent to a full course or a fraction of a full course.

• The apparatus for stitching the various layers of the bias laid, non-woven fabric together can be any of the machines presently employed in the textile industry for such a purpose. The Liba Copcentra-HS machine is suitable for formation of fabrics in accordance with the present invention. The machine is provided with an oscillating crank mechanism that slows down near the end of each stroke.

• The present invention provides for the formation of bias laid fabrics where all of the yarns in a given layer are parallel to each other. The parallelism in a given layer is achieved without complex machinery, and the number of yarns need not equal the number of needles over a given linear dimension. This allows for greater density and uniformity.

• The fabric formed in accordance with the present process is generally used in the formation of structural parts, such as airplanes, and is wrapped around a mold or laid into a particular position after being impregnated with a resin. The resin is cured to complete formation of the part. Other methods for holding the non-woven fabric in place can be employed, such as loose knitting or a light resin spray.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis. The process involves reacting 142b with hydrogen fluoride (HF) in the presence of a chromium catalyst to produce 143a. The reaction is carried out at a temperature between 100° C. and 400° C. and a pressure between 1 atmosphere and 200 psig. The molar ratio of HF to 142b is greater than 1:1, preferably between 2:1 and 5:1.

• The catalyst used in the process is a chromium salt, which can be supported or unsupported. The supported catalyst is preferably Cr/Ni/AlF3, while the unsupported catalyst is CrF3.4H2O. The catalyst is activated by heating it in a stream of nitrogen or air at a temperature between 200° C. and 500° C. The activation process is followed by HF activation at a temperature between 200° C. and 500° C.

• The process can be carried out in a fixed bed reactor or a fluidized bed reactor. The reactor is preferably a plug flow reactor to achieve high conversion in an efficient manner. The reactor can be cooled or not cooled, as long as the proper reaction conditions are maintained. The materials of construction should be able to withstand HF and HCl at reaction temperatures.

• The process can be run under adiabatic conditions, e.g., in a continuous, plug flow adiabatic reactor. The adiabatic reactor is designed to minimize heat transfer in either direction, and the temperature profile along the axis of the reactor is measured using internal temperature probes. The maximum bed temperature is located between the two probes, and the adiabatic temperature rise is calculated by lowering the feed rates by 10%.

• The process can be used to produce 143a with high conversion and selectivity. The conversion is generally in excess of 99.5%, and the selectivity is also very high, typically above 99%. The process can be run continuously for several hours without any evidence of catalyst deactivation. The catalyst can be regenerated by heating it in air at a temperature between 350° C. and 450° C.

• The process can also be used to remove low levels of olefinic material from

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots. The method aims to eliminate the disadvantages of existing methods, such as residual fibers and non-homogeneous mixtures. The invention measures the entire momentary quantity of each stored fiber lot before removing a partial quantity. This partial quantity is determined based on a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity. The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.

* The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener. The bale opener may be a plucker, stripper roll, spiked apron, or picker, while the quantity measuring device may be a frequency counter, weighing device, or height-measuring arrangement. The control device determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation. The control device may have a timing relay that predetermines a maximum period to ensure that the partial quantity is removed within a certain time.

* The method according to the invention has several advantages, including the ability to correct deviations during the next pass and the formation of a finely dosed mixture during each pass. The method also allows for the removal of partial quantities from each fiber bale in succession in a fixed number of passes. This method is particularly adapted for making mixtures of throughout constant quantity proportions. The invention also relates to an apparatus for performing the method, which includes a bale opener and a quantity measuring device.

* The apparatus may have a fiber removing apparatus that opens the fiber bales from above and has an electromechanical height-measuring device. The fiber bales are positioned on a platform, and a vertical stand travels along the platform to remove fibers from each bale. The control device may have a timing relay that predetermines a maximum period to ensure that the partial quantity is removed within a certain time. The control device also controls the displacement of the transporting device on which the bale opener is mounted.

* The method according to the invention is described in three examples, which illustrate the removal of partial quantities from fiber bales in a predetermined number of passes. The examples show how the method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained. The method also allows for the removal of partial quantities from each fiber bale in succession in a fixed number of passes. The examples demonstrate the

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board, designed to keep the electrical cord of an electric iron organized and out of the way while ironing, and to hold small items such as spray starch or a beverage container within easy reach. The device includes a clamp that attaches to the ironing board, a flexible cord support that can be raised or lowered, and a detachable article holder.
* The cord support is designed to be adjustable and can be secured in a raised position using a detent, and the article holder is removable for easy storage. The device also includes an electrical outlet that can be mounted to the clamp, allowing the iron to be plugged in and kept organized.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to rolls for use in nipped roll presses, particularly in the manufacture of paper, and provides apparatus and methods for accurately detecting, measuring, and removing the effects of rotational variability from a covered roll used in nip presses. The invention compensates for this effect, allowing a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile to be calculated and displayed. The invention uses multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel the effects of rotational variability.

• The invention provides advantages over sensing rolls and systems that utilize a single sensor assigned to measure the pressure at a particular cross-directional position. The use of multiple sensors allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, which can provide the operator with additional real-time information to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile. The invention can be used in collaboration with correcting instrumentation to eliminate or compensate for pressure variability at locations across the sensing roll of the press.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, ensuring continuous operation and allowing for the use of relatively stiff strips of material.
* The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip, controlling a signal transmitter for a setting means for the stop.
* The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring and can be moved into a position in which the signal transmitter is actuated independently of the strip.
* The device also includes a control setup with a proximity switch that is actuated by a switch arm on the lever, controlling a solenoid valve to start the operation for stopping the sewing machine.
* The device operates by first lifting the supporting member and stop screw, then introducing a new cut of fabric and feeding a strip of material through the guide apparatus until it butts against the stop.
* The stop is then retracted from the feed path, and the presser foot is lowered, starting the sewing machine again to perform the sewing operation.
* The device allows for continuous operation, making it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances, providing a simple and rugged design for feeding strip materials to a workpiece.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments, particularly using non-eductive drawing, and provides improvements over prior art systems.
• The system and method of the present invention involve an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width, producing a linear plane of filaments with substantially constant filament distribution.
• The process equipment is simple compared to both eductive and non-eductive systems, and no air is educted into the system as the quench fluid undergoes uniform acceleration into the impingement slot.
• The same air is used for both quenching the filaments and drawing them as the air exits through the drawing impingement slot at high velocity.
• The drawing chamber is relatively small, and higher quench pressures can be obtained without leading to structural deflection problems, producing very high air and fiber velocities.
• The system allows for easy control of filament denier by adjusting the slot gap opening, air flow rate, exhaust air flow rate, quench air temperature, polymer temperature, polymer viscosity, and polymer throughput per capillary.
• The filaments are exposed to the interior of a high-speed air stream, producing good energy transfer from quench fluid velocity to fiber speed, and the laydown speed of the fibers is significantly slower than in conventional systems.
• The web forming table positioned below the slot of the quench chamber receives filaments and forms them into a non-woven web, which can be strengthened by conventional techniques to produce the final non-woven fabric web.
• The method and apparatus of the present invention are useful for making fine continuous filaments, even if they are not formed into a spunbond web, and can be used for various applications such as pillow and cushion stuffing, industrial filtration, and hygiene products.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine that uses a computer-aided design program to create and duplicate patterns on large fabrics such as bedspreads and quilts. The machine consists of a frame quilting table that can move in the X and Y directions, and a sewing machine head that is controlled by a separate computer. The quilting table movement is controlled by a process controller that receives input from a joystick or mouse and sends commands to the X and Y motors. The process controller also sends voltage commands to the sewing machine controller, which converts them into RPM commands to control the sewing machine.

• The invention allows for the segregation of the computer controlling the sewing functions from the computer controlling the quilting table movement, making it easier to reprogram the machine. The sewing machine controller can be independently reprogrammed to change stitch patterns or add new stitches without affecting the quilting table movement. The quilting table movement can also be reprogrammed independently to change the pattern or add new patterns. This segregation of computers greatly simplifies the reprogramming process.

• The machine can be used to create complex patterns and designs, and the computer-aided design program allows for the automatic conversion of hand-drawn patterns into machine-readable form. The program can also be used to duplicate patterns at multiple locations on the fabric. The invention is not limited to any particular form or arrangement, and can be modified in various ways without departing from the spirit or scope of the claimed invention. The machine is designed to increase the rate of production of hand-guided patterns sewn into large fabrics.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to buttonhole controlling devices for a sewing machine, which can be used to select the length of a buttonhole to be sewn and automatically sew a buttonhole of the selected length. The device is designed to work effectively with different types of materials, which can vary in the extent to which they slip relative to the feed dog of a machine during sewing. This can cause buttonholes to be formed with stitching that fails to close or extends beyond the desired point of closure. The device aims to provide a solution to this problem.

* The buttonhole controlling device includes a foot pad that attaches to a presser bar and a travelling assembly that moves with the work being fed during the sewing of a buttonhole. The travelling assembly includes a slidable member that can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn. The slidable member carries a tab that actuates a tripping lever on the machine during movement of the assembly. This causes the length of the buttonhole to be limited to that suitable for the button inserted in the travelling assembly.

* The device also includes an adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly that engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole. By properly positioning the stop, an operator can precisely define the closure point and prevent the formation of an open buttonhole or one with overlapping stitches. The adjustable stop is an essential feature of the device, allowing it to work effectively with different types of materials. The stop can be adjusted by an operator using a screw and knob.

* The device is designed to work with a sewing machine that can sew a buttonhole in response to the operation of flexible contacts. The machine operates in a buttonhole mode to sew a buttonhole when the contacts are engaged. The device controls the operation of the tripping lever, which in turn controls the flexible contacts. The machine sews top bar stitches and left leg zig-zag stitches when the tripping lever is in a forward position.

* The device is also designed to work with a sample piece of material that is located between the shoe and plate of the travelling assembly. The buttonhole start line on the material is located in an aperture formed in the foot pad. The presser bar is depressed with a handle, and the initial position of the travelling assembly is defined by springs. The screw of the adjustable stop is roughly adjusted by the operator to locate it in an intermediate position.

* When the machine is placed in a buttonhole mode, it sews the top bar stitches through the

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner that induces ambient air to flow into the access opening of the machine whenever the door is opened, without exhausting the tubs. This system is particularly adapted to provide air flow without exhausting the tubs, which is important when using expensive and volatile cleaning solvents. The system includes a separate intake fan and duct that is interposed between the access opening of the machine housing and the open ends of the interior tubs. The duct includes a normally closed valve that isolates the separate intake system from the solvent vapors during normal operation.

• The dry cleaning machine of the present invention includes a pair of nested tubs, a drive motor, a pump, a blower, and a refrigeration system. The machine also includes a header chamber that is attached to the outer tub and has a pair of airflow hoses attached thereto. The header chamber is in air-flow communication with the inner tub through the forward facing opening of the tub. The machine also includes a timer mechanism that controls the operation of the electrical components.

• The solvent flow system of the machine includes a pump that pumps the solvent from the storage tank through a filter and into the tubs. The system also includes a diverter valve that directs the flow of solvent into the tubs or back to the storage tank. The system is designed to provide continuous filtration of the solvent during the fill and wash portion of the cycle. The system also includes a safety line that connects the top of the button tank to the storage tank to accommodate the solvent flow in the event the button trap becomes clogged.

• The air flow system of the machine includes a blower that circulates heated air through the tubs during the drying portion of the cycle. The system also includes a pair of airflow hoses that are attached to the header chamber and are controlled by electrically energized one-way valves. The system is designed to provide a closed circulation path for the air and vapor mixture during the dry portion of the cycle. The system also includes a lint box and a condenser housing that contains the evaporator coils of the refrigeration unit.

• The refrigeration system of the machine includes a compression-type refrigeration unit that condenses the vapors in the condenser box and maintains the liquid solvent in the storage tank at a predetermined temperature. The system includes a thermostat that senses the temperature of the solvent in the storage tank and energizes the refrigeration unit when the temperature exceeds a predetermined limit. The system also includes a switch that is controlled

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution. The invention aims to provide an improved apparatus that can adequately effectuate washing or rinsing without maintaining the textile web in a stacked configuration. This is particularly important for materials like knitted fabrics that are sensitive to tension.

* The apparatus comprises a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The conveyor includes an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined substantially horizontal path. The liquid applicator is disposed at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion thereof along the path.

* The suction device is disposed at a second station along the path at a point downstream of the first station for removing the liquid from the web by a suction process during motion of the web along the path. The suction device preferably extends transversely to the web and to the belt and is disposed below and substantially juxtaposed to an upper section of the belt. The suction device causes the textile web to adhere to the belt and to be entrained thereby.

* The dwell stretch is disposed between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop. The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass, which includes a plurality of freely rotatable rollers arranged in two planes above the upper section of the sieve belt. Alternatively, the dwell stretch can include at least one freely rotatable drum disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt.

* In the case of printed material, the fabric treatment apparatus is especially advantageous in that effective washing is possible without soiling a white background. The washing solution is spread onto the textile web, and the cloth is neither placed into a stacked configuration nor run through a vat or the like. This makes the apparatus suitable for treating materials with printed matter.

* A preferred area of application of the invention is so-called "soilage washing," because considerable amounts of soilage can be removed at relatively little expense. A fastness treatment as such may follow a washing operation in accordance with the invention. The apparatus can have a compact construction, particularly if the textile web is guided back from the dwell loop to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point where the web leaves the belt.

* The apparatus can include multiple assembly units, each comprising a liquid applicator, a dwell stretch, and a suction device. The assembly

<summary>
• The present invention relates to fabrics and textiles, specifically cellulosic fabric or textile materials, and methods of applying functional utility-enhancing preparations onto these materials. The invention aims to provide textile articles with improved functional durability. The preparations comprise a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, with the functional additive carried by the wool particles. The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below.

• The invention also provides a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprising a mixture of powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents. The non-charcoal fibrous bamboo powder is nano-sized, having an ultrafine particle size of 1 μm or below. Fabric materials treated with ultrafine bamboo fibre powder have good moisture management properties. The preparation may be bonded to or deposited onto the cellulosic fabric by printing, padding, or foam application.

• The method of preparing a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprises pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size and forming an ultrafine wool suspension using the ultrafine wool powder. The method may also comprise adding 0.5-2g/l wetting agent and 4-10g/l ultrafine wool powder into water to form the suspension. The suspension may be homogenized, and the preparation may be bonded or deposited onto the textile material by printing, padding, or foam application.

• The functional additives may include additives for ultraviolet protection, anti-bacteria, or other clothing functions. The wool particles or wool powder may have a size of 200 nm or below and may have a helix or helical structure capable of carrying the functional additives. The functional additive may comprise an anti-UV agent, such as zinc oxide or titanium oxide, or an anti-bacterial agent, such as nano-silver or zinc oxide. The functional additive may be in ultrafine powder form having a nano-sized particle of between 100-200 nm.

• The preparation may be provided to enhance moisture management, wicking, and/or wrinkling resistance properties of the article. The treated fabric may have improved ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, and wrinkle recovery. The ultrafine wool powder may enhance the wrinkle recovery of cotton fabrics due to its helical spring-like structure macrofibrils. The treated fabric may also have improved moisture management properties, with increased wicking height and water diffusion speed. The preparation may be applied onto the fabric by printing, padding

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments such as sweaters, tank tops, and aprons.
* The invention aims to solve the problems of increased thickness, impaired productivity, and irregular sewing in traditional methods of joining tape-shaped knit fabrics.
* The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, one or both of which are movable in the longitudinal direction.
* The two knit pieces are positioned with a boundary between them on either of the front and rear needle beds and are knitted to a specified length.
* The loops of the final course of both knit pieces are overlaid and bound off gradually by repeating a sequence of steps.
* The overlaid loops are transferred and overlaid on each other, and a new loop is formed on the overlaid portion, decreasing the number of loops in the moving side knit fabric.
* The process is repeated by a proper number of times depending on the width of the knit fabric until the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined.
* The final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening the stitch, and the joined ends are terminated by locking the loop and dislocating it from the knitting needle.
* The invention can be realized using various types of knitting machines and needle beds, and the matrix texture of the belt-shaped knit fabric can be plain knitting, rib knitting, or any other type.
* The invention can be applied to various parts of garments, such as the neck rope part of a tank top, a lower end portion of baseball stockings, and a neck rope part of an apron.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present disclosure relates to a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that allow sewing in a position specified on a work cloth. The sewing machine includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory. The detecting portion detects an ultrasonic wave transmitted from a transmission source. The memory stores computer-readable instructions that instruct the sewing machine to execute steps including identifying a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave based on information pertaining to the ultrasonic wave that has been detected by the detecting portion, and controlling sewing based on the position of the transmission source that has been identified.

• The embroidery unit can be attached to and detached from a bed of a sewing machine, and to which an embroidery frame can be attached, and is configured to move the embroidery frame. The embroidery unit includes at least one detecting portion and a notifying portion. The detecting portion detects an ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from a transmission source. The notifying portion notifies the sewing machine of a detection timing at which the ultrasonic wave was detected by the detecting portion. The embroidery unit is configured to move the work cloth based on a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave that has been identified by the sewing machine based on the detection timing that has been notified by the notifying portion.

• The non-transitory computer-readable medium stores a control program executable on a sewing machine. The program includes computer-readable instructions, when executed, to cause the sewing machine to perform the step of identifying, based on information pertaining to an ultrasonic wave that has been detected by at least one detecting portion of the sewing machine, a position of a transmission source of the ultrasonic wave. The detecting portion is configured to detect the ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from the transmission source. The program further includes computer-readable instructions, when executed, to cause the sewing machine to perform the step of controlling sewing based on the position of the transmission source that has been identified.

• The sewing machine includes a bed, a pillar, an arm, and a head. The bed is a base portion of the sewing machine and extends in the left-right direction. The pillar extends upward from the right end of the bed. The arm extends to the left from the upper end of the pillar such that the arm faces the bed. The head is provided on the left end of the arm. A needle plate is disposed on a top surface of the bed. A feed dog, a feed mechanism, a shuttle mechanism, and a

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods of making nonwoven fabrics, particularly a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric exhibiting a three-dimensional image. The production of conventional textile fabrics is a complex, multi-step process, whereas nonwoven fabrics are produced directly from the carding process, making them more efficient. Nonwoven fabrics are suitable for various applications, but they have been disadvantaged in terms of resistance to elongation. The present invention aims to address this issue.

* The present invention involves forming a two-sided nonwoven fabric by hydroentanglement, with three-dimensional imaging of the fabrics enhanced by incorporating at least one fluid-pervious support layer or scrim. The support layer acts as a fiber distribution control layer between the two sides, deterring excessive intermingling of the fibrous constituents. The fabric exhibits a pronounced difference in surface performance properties inherent to the fibrous matrix used. The incorporation of a support layer improves the overall performance of the two-sided fabric.

* A method of making the present two-sided, three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric involves providing at least a first precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web comprising a second fibrous matrix. A median support layer or scrim is interposed between the precursor webs, which are then subjected to hydroentangling on a three-dimensional image transfer device. The image transfer device defines three-dimensional elements against the precursor web, displacing the first fibrous matrix into the three-dimensional topography. The second fibrous matrix is significantly retained on the side away from the three-dimensional topography.

* The precursor webs are formed into a three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric by hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device. The fabric may comprise apertures of various shapes and sizes, which may extend through one or more layers of the fabric. The material of the present invention may be utilized in the construction of numerous home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and other end-use products. The imaged nonwoven fabric may be used as a landing zone affixed to disposable absorbent articles.

* The present invention contemplates that the fluid-pervious support layer or scrim be any suitable material, including wovens, knits, open mesh scrims, and/or nonwoven fabrics, which exhibit low elongation performance. Two particular nonwoven fabrics of particular benefit are spunbond fabrics and nanofiber fabrics. A particularly preferred embodiment of support layer or scrim is a thermoplastic spun

<summary>
* The present invention is a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through a combination of completion of coagulation, washing with water having a non-alkaline pH, and drying.
* The process eliminates the need for desulphurating and bleaching treatments, reducing the number of treatments and the space take-up of spinning machines, while obtaining a higher degree of whiteness than commonly accepted.
* The invention also includes the chemical composition of the wash water, which should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from cations in amounts higher than specified limits, and can be obtained by treating water with weakly acid ion exchange resins.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook arrangement that prevents co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing, allowing for a smooth and unhindered movement of the needle thread loop. The holding means are arranged on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, enabling the needle thread loop to expand freely until its maximum expansion is reached.
* The rotary hook arrangement includes a spring rod that extends between two cams, which cooperate with a projection of the housing to control the rotation of the bobbin housing. The spring rod is designed to be bent back by the needle thread loop, causing only a slight increase in needle thread tension.
* The invention also features a capsule release device that gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod. This allows the needle thread loop to slip through the thread passage gap entirely unhindered, reducing the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation.
* The rotary hook arrangement is designed to be simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture, with a preferred embodiment illustrated in the accompanying drawings. The invention provides a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook that is outstanding for its jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop.</summary>

<summary>
• This invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio, designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process and topology optimization technique.
• The BTR composite materials consist of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be arranged in various configurations, including flat, curved, and three-dimensional structures, and can be used in various applications, such as aerospace, automotive, and military industries.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is directed to an arrangement for the control of thread tension in a spool creel having several spool holders, each provided with a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element.
* The arrangement has a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different corresponding one of the spool holders, and each having a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension-responsive braking element.
* The controllers are simultaneously settable by fluid pressure, allowing for improved tension control and the ability to centrally set the thread tension for the entire creel.
* The biasing arrangement, preferably a piston/cylinder assembly, operates by fluid pressure and can influence the tensioning lever without hindering its swinging action.
* The invention also allows for rapid braking action when the warping machine is shut off, by increasing the braking force throughout the entire creel.
* The arrangement can be modified to use an electromagnetic brake, where the magnetic system brakes by generating eddy currents in a braking disc, allowing for global alteration of thread tension and rapid braking.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet with a dual construction comprising an outer casing and an inner casing, providing excellent mechanical strength and allowing for the formation of a clearance between the casings to house boxes, shelves, and wirings without projecting into the cabinet or outer periphery.
* The invention also provides a bedroom cabinet with a clearance between the outer and inner casings formed over the whole periphery, using spacer members with venting grooves to create a uniform airflow passage for natural ventilation and increased sound-proofing effect.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine. The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine. The conventional detector has several disadvantages, including the influence of static noise, vibration, and electromagnetic waves. The conventional detector also has a relatively thick and non-compact detecting section.

• The present invention overcomes the disadvantages of the conventional detector by providing a low-price detector that is durable despite the detrimental effects of vibration and includes a thinner and more compact detecting section. The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that are mounted coaxially to a shaft connected to a sewing machine shaft.
