<summary>
• Professor B discusses the current state of the Aurora project, specifically the issue of voice activity detection and its impact on the evaluation criteria. He mentions that the current baseline has improved by 22% due to the use of voice activity detectors. However, there is a proposal to change the evaluation criteria to require a 25% improvement for mismatched conditions and 50% for well-matched conditions. Professor B expresses his concerns about this proposal, stating that it may not be fair to change the criteria after two years of work. He also mentions that Nokia and Qualcomm are objecting to this proposal.

• Professor B explains the concept of TRAPS (Temporal Patterns) recognition, which involves recognizing speech based on the time trajectory of energy at a given frequency. He mentions that this approach is still in its early stages and requires further research. The team is currently exploring ways to improve the robustness of the mel spectrum to noise, including the use of LPC models and spectral subtraction. Professor B also mentions the idea of adding noise to the training data to make it more uniform.

• The team discusses the idea of modifying the variance of the Gaussian models to adjust the importance of different features. Professor B suggests that this can be done by multiplying the standard deviation of the model by a constant, which would effectively make the feature more or less important. However, he notes that this would require retraining the model. PhD E suggests an alternative approach, which involves modifying the test data by compressing or expanding the feature values.

• The team explores the idea of using a genetic algorithm to search for the optimal set of exponents for the feature values. Professor B mentions that this approach would require a large amount of computing power and data. However, he notes that it could be a useful way to explore the space of possible solutions. PhD E suggests that a simpler approach might be to use a grid search, which would involve trying out a range of different exponents and evaluating their performance.

• The team discusses the idea of using the new Linux boxes to run experiments on the HTK system. Professor B mentions that the boxes have five processors and two gigs of memory, making them well-suited for running large-scale experiments. PhD E suggests that they could use the boxes to run a series of experiments on the importance of different features, using the approach discussed earlier. Professor B notes that this could be a useful way to explore the space of possible solutions and to identify the most important features for the task at hand.</summary>

• The government has introduced a new pilot to address schools that are causing concern, which includes a multi-agency approach and a more strategic, longer-term plan for improvement, and has seen positive initial feedback.
• The Minister for Education, Kirsty Williams, has stated that she is not content with the current level of schools in the red category, particularly in the secondary sector, and is working to address this through the new pilot and other initiatives.
• Despite progress in some areas, the attainment gap between pupils eligible for free school meals and those who are not persists, and the government will continue to focus resources on closing this gap, with a focus on early intervention and support.</summary>

* The industrial designer presented his ideas for the remote control's design, including a single button and a speech recognition feature. The team discussed the pros and cons of different design options.
* The team discussed the possibility of adding a T_F_T_ display or an L_C_D_ interface, but decided that it might be too expensive and complicated. They also considered the idea of a glow-in-the-dark material, but decided it might not be practical.

* The project manager summarized the team's decisions and assigned tasks to each team member. The team agreed to put their reports in the project documents folder and to keep each other updated on their progress.
* The team discussed the importance of integrating the company's logo and slogan into the design, and decided to use a yellow color scheme. They also considered the idea of using a rubbery material for the remote control's casing.
* The project manager concluded the meeting and encouraged the team to ask questions and raise concerns. The team members seemed to be in agreement and were looking forward to working on the project.</summary>

<summary>
• The Welsh Government has been working to improve school standards, with a focus on self-evaluation and a more robust approach to identifying schools that need support. The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) has been involved in the process, providing external verification of the system's progress. The OECD's report is expected to be published in March, and the Minister for Education, Kirsty Williams, will make a statement to the Chamber on the report's findings. The report will provide an honest evaluation of the system's progress and identify areas for improvement.

• The school categorisation system has evolved over time, with changes made to address concerns around accountability and support for schools. The system is primarily used as a triage system to identify schools that need support, rather than as a means of accountability. The Minister expects the system to continue to evolve, with a focus on aligning it with the overall approach to school improvement and raising standards. The OECD's feedback on the system will be taken into account in any future changes.

• The Minister has introduced a new pilot to address schools that are causing concern, with a focus on early identification and support. The pilot involves a multi-agency approach, with local authorities, regional consortia, Estyn, and Welsh Government working together to support schools. The approach is designed to provide a more strategic and longer-term approach to improving schools, rather than just focusing on short-term gains. The pilot is being evaluated by Cardiff Metropolitan University and Swansea University.

• The regional consortia have a key role to play in supporting schools, particularly in the context of the new curriculum. The Minister has changed her view on the consortia, recognizing the value of regional working in delivering school improvement services. However, there are still concerns around the consistency of the consortia's performance, with some performing better than others. The Minister is working with the consortia to address these concerns and ensure that they are delivering effective support to schools.

• The Minister is committed to closing the attainment gap between pupils who are eligible for free school meals and those who are not. Despite significant investment in the pupil development grant, the problem persists, and in some places, it is deteriorating. The Minister acknowledges that more needs to be done to support these learners, and is looking to amend practice based on evidence from experts. The focus will be on getting it right for these children from the moment they start their formal education, rather than just providing catch-up support later on.</summary>

The Welsh Government has not used these powers to date, but the Minister believes it is essential to have a collective effort to address concerns in schools.

The resource is being developed in conjunction with the OECD, middle tier, and practitioners. The Minister believes that this resource will help develop the skills within the system to have robust self-evaluation. The resource will be introduced across the system at the start of the new academic year in September 2020.

The Minister expects the system to continue to evolve and change to align with the curriculum reform and changes in self-evaluation. • The Minister discussed the issue of schools causing concern, particularly in the secondary sector. <summary>
• The episode begins with Booth and Brennan in therapy with Dr. Sweets, who is trying to help them work through their partnership issues. Booth is resistant to the therapy, but Brennan is more open to it. Sweets explains that the FBI is considering severing their partnership due to Booth's arrest of Brennan's father. Booth and Brennan are given a questionnaire to fill out, which they are not supposed to discuss with each other.

• The team is called to a crime scene where a body has been found, and they soon discover that the victim is Franklin Curtis, a wealthy businessman who founded the Natural Sun organic supermarket chain. The investigation reveals that Curtis was a womanizer and had many enemies. Booth and Brennan interview Curtis's wife and daughter, who both seem shaken by his death.

• As the investigation continues, the team discovers that Curtis's body was cooked, and they find a second victim, a young woman named Emma Billings, who was Curtis's daughter. The team also finds a pitchfork, which they believe is the murder weapon. They discover that the killer used bio-diesel fuel, which leads them to a suspect, Charlie Rogan.

• The team interviews Charlie, who seems cooperative, but they soon discover that he is hiding something. They find evidence that links him to the crime scene, and he is arrested. However, further investigation reveals that Charlie did not act alone, and that Kat Curtis, Franklin's daughter, was also involved in the murder.

• The team discovers that Kat killed Emma, who was her half-sister, and that Charlie helped her dispose of the body. They also discover that Kat's motive was to protect her mother's interests, as Franklin had left his estate to environmental groups. The team is able to piece together the events of the crime and bring the perpetrators to justice.

• The episode ends with Booth and Brennan back in therapy with Dr. Sweets, who is pleased with their progress. Sweets notes that they have a deep emotional attachment to each other, but Booth and Brennan deny it. Sweets suggests that they need to work on their underlying issues, but Booth and Brennan are resistant to the idea. The episode ends with a hint that there may be more to Booth and Brennan's relationship than they are letting on.</summary>

However, they soon become obsessed with gaining access to the "gold level" of the spa, which is restricted to a select few. They try to bribe the receptionist and use their connections to get in, but are unsuccessful. Frasier becomes increasingly frustrated and feels that he is being unfairly excluded.

* Meanwhile, back at the apartment, Martin is watching an episode of "The Rockford Files" with Daphne, who teases him about his resemblance to the show's protagonist, Jim Rockford. Martin is initially defensive, but eventually warms up to the comparison. However, when Daphne starts to compare him to the show's older characters, Martin becomes annoyed and turns off the TV.

* Roz tries to help Frasier and Niles get into the gold level of the spa by calling in a favor from Senator Ogden, who owes her one. However, when the senator arrives at Cafe Nervosa to discuss the matter, he suddenly clutches his chest and falls to the floor. Roz is forced to give him CPR, and the scene ends with her looking frustrated and annoyed.

* In the final scene, Frasier and Niles are determined to see what's behind the platinum door, despite the attendant's warnings. They manage to sneak past the attendant and make their way through the door, but are shocked to find themselves in a dirty alleyway next to a trash dumpster. They realize that they have

<summary>
* The Zeta Beta Zeta sorority is having a slumber party, where Casey is trying to bond with the pledges and gain their votes for the upcoming presidential election. However, Rebecca is trying to sabotage the event by telling ghost stories and making the girls believe that the house is haunted by the spirit of Virginia, a former ZBZ sister who died under mysterious circumstances. The girls start to get spooked, and things take a turn for the worse when the chandelier falls down. Casey tries to calm everyone down, but Rebecca continues to fuel the hysteria.

* Meanwhile, at the Omega Chi house, Evan and Calvin are trying to catch a mouse that has been causing trouble. They bond over their shared love of horror movies and have a fun and scary time trying to catch the mouse. However, things take a dark turn when Evan reveals that he doesn't have a sister who died in a shark attack, and Calvin starts to get suspicious. The two continue to try and catch the mouse, but it remains elusive.

* At the Kappa Tau house, Cappie meets a mysterious girl named Destiny who claims that her bike broke down outside the house. However, Rusty discovers that Destiny is actually Patty, a girl from Cappie's past who had a crush on him. Patty has been stalking Cappie and has created a shrine to him in the bathroom. Cappie is initially flattered, but things take a dark turn when Patty's obsession becomes clear. Rusty tries to warn Cappie, but he is too smitten to listen.

* In the end, the ZBZ girls hold a séance to try and contact Virginia's spirit, but it ends in chaos when the wind blows open a window and the girls get spooked. However, they eventually discover that Virginia's spirit was trying to tell them something - that she was cheated out of the presidential election. The girls rehold the election and Virginia wins posthumously. The episode ends with Casey reflecting on the events of the night and the girls bonding over their shared experience. The Omega Chi guys also reflect on their night, and Cappie is left wondering if he is a bad kisser. The episode ends with a comedic moment when Beaver finds Timmy, a lost kid, outside the Kappa Tau house.</summary>

<summary>
* Veronica Mars is hired by Mindy O'Dell to investigate the death of her husband, Dean O'Dell, who was found dead in his office with a bullet wound to the head.
* Veronica also takes on a case involving a missing monkey, Twenty-five, who was stolen from a lab at Hearst College, along with twenty control-group rats.
* Veronica and her friend Mac go undercover at a PHAT (People for Humane Animal Treatment) meeting to gather information about the missing monkey.
* Veronica discovers that the missing monkey is being hidden by Gil Thomas, one of the lab assistants, who had grown attached to the animal and wanted to save it from being euthanized.
* Meanwhile, Veronica's personal life is complicated by her recent breakup with Logan Echolls and her growing feelings for Piz, a radio DJ at Hearst College.
* The episode ends with Veronica reuniting with Logan and sharing a passionate kiss, while Keith Mars investigates Dean O'Dell's death and shares a drink with Professor Landry at a bar.</summary>

<summary>
*A wedding day in Pine Valley is filled with drama and unexpected twists, as Bianca and Reese prepare to tie the knot, while Ryan and Greenlee's ceremony is put on hold due to Greenlee's sudden departure.
*Kendall is upset upon learning that Reese and Bianca have decided to stay in Pine Valley, which she believes is due to Reese's feelings for Zach, and her emotions boil over as she gets into a heated argument with Zach.
*Meanwhile, Annie's obsession with Ryan reaches a boiling point as she pulls a gun on him, and Greenlee's attempt to escape the drama ends in a shocking and potentially deadly accident as she flies her motorcycle off a cliff.</summary>

<summary>
* The narrator, Ted, begins telling his children the story of how he met their mother, but first, he tells them a story about a girl named Natalie. The story starts with Ted wearing a shirt he had for six years but never liked until that morning. He realizes his tastes have changed and wonders if he should reevaluate his past relationships.

* Ted's friends, Marshall, Lily, Barney, and Robin, discuss his idea of reevaluating past relationships, and they bring up the names of girls he dated in the past, including Natalie. Ted decides to call Natalie, who he hasn't seen in three years, and ask her out again. However, when he calls her, she hangs up on him.

* Ted visits Natalie's apartment and apologizes for breaking up with her on her birthday three years ago via answering machine. Natalie is still hurt, but Ted convinces her to give him another chance, and they start dating again. However, after three weeks, Ted realizes he's not in love with Natalie and decides to break up with her.

* Ted's friends advise him on how to break up with Natalie, but he decides to tell her the truth - that she's not the one for him. However, he chooses to do it on her birthday, which makes things worse. Natalie is devastated and feels that Ted has broken her heart again.

* Natalie, who has been taking Krav Maga classes, kicks Ted and beats him up after he breaks up with her. Ted returns to the bar, bruised and battered, and his friends try to console him. Meanwhile, Robin is dealing with her own embarrassment after a live newscast where she fell and got covered in horse crap.

* Despite the painful breakup, Ted realizes that sometimes things don't work out, and it's not always easy to do the right thing. He also learns that Natalie has moved on and is now married with three beautiful children. The experience teaches Ted a valuable lesson about relationships and heartbreak.

* The story ends with Ted's children laughing at their father's misfortune, and Ted reflecting on the experience, realizing that sometimes things happen for a reason, and it's not always easy to find the right person. The story sets the stage for Ted's future relationships and his eventual meeting with their mother. Ted's children are amused by their father's story, but Ted hopes they will learn from his experiences. The story is a reminder that relationships can be complicated and painful, but they are also a necessary part of life.</

<summary>
• J.R. is struggling with his feelings towards his father, Adam, who is trying to manipulate him with a large sum of money. Tad advises J.R. to focus on what he wants and not let Adam's actions dictate his life. J.R. reveals that in a perfect world, he would be sailing a yacht with Babe by his side.

• Babe is dealing with her own emotions, having kissed Richie Novak after learning he might be eligible for a bone marrow transplant. Krystal advises Babe to take her time and figure out her feelings, but also warns her that kissing Richie might be a way of avoiding her feelings for J.R. Babe is torn between her past love for J.R. and her growing feelings for Richie.

• Hannah is on the loose, having escaped from Zach and Josh, and is now seeking revenge against Kendall. Zach orders his men to take Hannah down, but Kendall is worried about the consequences of such an action. Hannah is shown to be unstable and willing to do whatever it takes to hurt Kendall.

• Colby is helping Dre, who is hiding from his father, a senator, due to their disagreements over his music career. Dre is grateful for Colby's help and they bond over their shared experiences of having difficult family relationships. Colby shows Dre the Chandler Mansion tunnels, which were once part of the Underground Railroad.

• Ryan is recovering from his gunshot wound and is grateful to be alive. Annie is by his side, but is also dealing with her own emotions and fears. Meanwhile, Hannah is shown to be getting closer to Sean, and the two share a kiss, setting the stage for a potential new storyline.</summary>

<summary>
• Sheldon is frustrated with his new wallet, which he bought online, because the removable ID takes up one of the eight slots. Leonard questions whether Sheldon really needs to carry his honorary Justice League of America membership card. Sheldon insists that he does, as it has been in every wallet he's owned since he was five.

• Raj's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Koothrappali, video chat with Raj and his friends, introducing themselves and asking about their academic pursuits. They also mention that they have given Raj's contact information to a dental student named Lalita Gupta, whom they think would be a good match for Raj. Raj is hesitant and unsure about the arrangement.

• Raj's parents inform him that Lalita's parents approve of the match and suggest a spring wedding to avoid the monsoon season. Raj is resistant to the idea, but his parents are insistent. Sheldon tries to explain the cultural context of arranged marriages, but Raj is uninterested.

• Howard offers to help Raj by pretending to be him and talking to Lalita on the phone. However, his attempt at a fake Indian accent and flirtatious conversation only embarrasses Raj. Raj decides to take matters into his own hands and meet Lalita in person.

• Penny offers to let Raj practice his social skills by helping her practice her bartending skills. Raj becomes drunk and starts talking to Penny, revealing his insecurities and fears about his arranged marriage. Penny tries to reassure him that everything will be okay.

• Raj meets Lalita at the restaurant, but the date quickly goes awry due to his drunkenness and awkwardness. Sheldon arrives and becomes infatuated with Lalita, who resembles a character from his favorite childhood story, "The Monkey and the Princess." Lalita is charmed by Sheldon's eccentricity and leaves with him, leaving Raj alone and embarrassed.

• Raj's parents are furious when they find out what happened on the date and blame Raj for being drunk and boring. Sheldon takes responsibility for his actions, but Raj is still angry and hurt. Raj's parents threaten to come to America and stage an intervention, but Raj tries to reassure them that he is not an alcoholic.

• The episode ends with Sheldon singing "To Life" from Fiddler on the Roof at Penny's restaurant, having apparently had a few too many drinks. Leonard is amused by Sheldon's antics, and Penny reveals that she may have spiked his drink as an experiment.</summary>

<summary>
• Sheldon Cooper announces the final episode of his internet show "Fun with Flags," but later decides to revive it after receiving a comment from a fan. He had initially decided to end the show due to balancing his career, relationship, and other responsibilities.

• Amy Farrah Fowler, Sheldon's girlfriend, co-hosts the show and helps him with the final episode, which features highlights from previous episodes. The episode also includes a guest appearance by LeVar Burton.

• Meanwhile, Leonard, Howard, and Raj are cleaning out the office of a deceased professor, Roger Abbott, and find his old notebooks and a letter from his mother. They try to decipher the meaning of the numbers in the notebooks, thinking it might be a breakthrough discovery.

• The trio discovers that the numbers are actually the professor's food diary, detailing his calorie intake in an attempt to live forever. They also learn that the professor's research never amounted to anything significant.

• Bernadette is at a conference with her boss, Dan, and Penny, where she is perceived as being mean and intimidating. Penny tries to help Bernadette show her softer side and be more sensitive to others.

• Bernadette apologizes to Dan for being rude about his grandson and learns that her coworkers have been paying for her coffee and using her private bathroom. She feels bad about her behavior and decides to change.

• The episode ends with Sheldon deciding to revive "Fun with Flags" and visiting LeVar Burton to ask him to appear in the next episode. LeVar is not pleased to see Sheldon and regrets not getting a gate to keep him out.

• Leonard and Sheldon have a heart-to-heart conversation about feeling sad and unappreciated, and Sheldon celebrates the revival of his show by opening a bottle of champagne. However, the champagne was meant to celebrate a breakthrough discovery, not the revival of the show.

• The episode ends with Sheldon visiting LeVar Burton's house, asking him to appear in the next episode of "Fun with Flags," and suggesting that he dress up like a swastika to talk about German flags. LeVar is not interested and wishes he had a gate to keep Sheldon out.
</summary>

<summary>
• Dr. Sinclair reveals to Aidan that Annie is back at Oak Haven, and he plans to keep his word by ensuring she pays for killing Richie. Annie is told that she will be declared fit to stand trial for Richie's murder after a hearing, and Dr. Sinclair accuses her of killing Greenlee by tampering with her motorcycle brakes.

• Kendall and Zach argue about his relationship with Reese, with Kendall accusing him of having an affair with her. Zach denies the affair but admits to kissing Reese, which he claims was a mistake.

• Ryan is desperate to find Greenlee and convinces Jesse to let him join the search efforts, despite the danger. Jesse eventually agrees, but the search is called off due to a storm, and Ryan is left frustrated and desperate.

• Bianca confronts Kendall about her behavior, and Kendall reveals that she knows about Reese's kiss with Zach. Bianca is shocked and hurt, and the two women argue about the situation.

• David Hayward is shown to be struggling with his own demons, including his feelings about Greenlee's death and his desire to be a part of Little A's life. He also makes it clear that he will stop at nothing to get what he wants, including manipulating Amanda and threatening J.R.

• The episode ends with Kendall having a vision of Greenlee, who tells her that Zach loves her and that she should hold on to that. Meanwhile, Reese tries to comfort Bianca, but Bianca is angry and hurt, and the two women have a tense confrontation.</summary>

<summary>
* The episode begins with Mr. Parker informing the group that Luke is gone and Kai has won. Tyler is upset with Luke for choosing death over him, while Damon tries to help Bonnie find a way to escape the prison world. Stefan informs the group that Caroline's mom is not doing well, and Liz asks Stefan to tell Caroline how proud she is of her. Caroline and Elena go casket shopping, and Elena tries to help Caroline prepare for the funeral.

* In a flashback, Caroline is shown as a child, falling off her bike and being comforted by her mom. Liz tells Caroline that she will always be there for her, but Caroline is worried about what will happen if Liz dies. Liz reassures Caroline that she will be okay and that she will always need her. The scene cuts back to the present, where Caroline is struggling to cope with her mom's death.

* Damon is trying to write a eulogy for Liz, but is struggling to find the right words. Stefan tries to offer his advice, but Damon is too proud to accept it. In a flashback, Damon is shown as a child, trying to write a eulogy for his mother's funeral. He is unable to finish it and instead gives the tie he was wearing to Stefan.

* Stefan asks Damon for advice on how to handle his feelings for Caroline, but Damon tells him to "pull the ripcord" if he's not sure. Damon leaves the room, and Stefan is left to think about his feelings. Meanwhile, Caroline is trying to prepare for the funeral and is struggling to cope with her emotions. Elena tries to offer her support, but Caroline is too proud to accept it.

* At the funeral, Damon gives a heartfelt eulogy, praising Liz for her strength and bravery. Caroline is visibly moved by his words and is comforted by Elena. After the funeral, Tyler tries to apologize to Caroline, but Matt stops him, telling him that he's not welcome. Tyler is drunk and Matt is worried about him.

* Bonnie is shown in the prison world, trying to find a way to escape. She discovers a journal that belongs to a woman who was trapped in the prison world in 1903. Bonnie realizes that she is in the Salvatore Boarding House and that the Northern Lights are a recurring celestial event. She uses this information to try and escape the prison world.

* Jo is shown to be pregnant, and Kai tells her that she needs to give him her magic in order to save the prison worlds. Al

<summary>
* Erica and Chris have a heart-to-heart conversation about their relationship, and Erica confesses that she has been feeling unfaithful to Chris due to her priorities being elsewhere. Chris forgives her and they agree to communicate better. However, Jack's meddling in their relationship continues to cause tension. Jack warns Chris that he shouldn't marry Erica, which leads to Erica accusing Jack of wanting her for himself.

* Meanwhile, Adam is searching for his missing son JR and accuses Jamie of hiding him. Jamie denies any involvement and the two get into an argument. Adam's conversation with Jamie reveals that JR has been avoiding his friends and family, and Adam suspects that Jamie is behind it. Jamie defends himself, saying that JR doesn't deserve Laurie and that Adam is a bad father.

* Tad goes on a date with Lysistrata, a therapist, and they engage in a series of witty banter and playful teasing. Lysistrata tries to get Tad to open up about his feelings, but he uses humor to deflect her questions. Despite this, they seem to have a strong connection and the date ends with a thrilling motorcycle ride. Lysistrata's unconventional approach to therapy and dating seems to be working on Tad, who is drawn to her wild and carefree personality.</summary>

<summary>
*Tad discovers Jake's online dating profile on "datermater.com" and teases him about it, leading to a humorous exchange between the two. Jake tries to shut down the laptop, but Tad continues to taunt him, eventually revealing that Jake has a match. The match is a woman named Pamela, who has posted a picture of her dog, Poochie, instead of herself.

*Pete tries to help Amanda, who is struggling to carry her bags, and learns that she is homeless after the Chandlers threw her out. Amanda reveals that she gave back the money David paid her to sabotage J.R. and couldn't go through with the job. Pete offers to call her doctor, but Amanda declines, saying she has too many doctors in her life already.

*Adam confronts Erica about his investment in Fusion, accusing her of lying to him and stealing his money. Erica denies the allegations and threatens to expose Adam's past misdeeds if he continues to harass her. Adam dares her to call the authorities, but Erica reveals that she has a plan to take him down.

*David tries to reassure Krystal that everything will be okay despite the power outage and cold weather. He suggests they have a romantic wedding with candles and a roaring fire, but Krystal is hesitant. David tells Krystal that he can feel their deceased daughter's presence and that she wants them to be happy.

*Amanda is furious with J.R. for trying to take custody of their unborn child and refuses to sign the agreement. J.R. claims that he wants to raise the child on his own and provide a stable home, but Amanda accuses him of being a power-hungry control freak. The argument ends with Amanda quitting her job at Fusion.

*Erica tries to convince Adam to join forces and help her save Fusion, but Adam is skeptical. Erica reveals that she has a plan to turn the company around and offers Adam a chance to be her partner. Adam is intrigued and agrees to consider the proposal.

*Tad tries to apologize to Krystal for his past behavior, but she reveals that she is getting married to David. Tad is shocked and tries to understand why Krystal is making this decision. Krystal claims that she loves David and wants to move on with her life.

*The scene ends with David and Krystal's wedding ceremony, where they exchange vows and promise to love each other. Meanwhile, J.R. is seen drinking alone, and Amanda is spotting, causing concern for her unborn child.

<summary>
• Krystal is in the hospital after being attacked by Colby, and David is nowhere to be found. Angie and Tad discuss Krystal's condition and David's absence. Tad thinks David doesn't care about Krystal, but Angie defends him. Krystal later reveals that she called David multiple times, but he didn't answer.

• David arrives at the police station, demanding to know where his grandson is. Jesse refuses to tell him, citing that J.R. is in jail and the boy is in foster care. David threatens Jesse, who stands firm and tells David to leave. David vows to get his grandson back.

• Colby is worried about J.R. and the consequences of her actions. J.R. tells her to let him handle things and that Barry will help her. Colby is scared and wants to see Adam, who is in the hospital under an assumed name. J.R. warns her that the police will follow her and arrest Adam if she visits him.

• Ryan and Kendall discuss their relationship and the fact that they're both hurting. Ryan feels guilty about being with Kendall, who is still married to Zach. Kendall tries to justify their relationship, but Ryan is unconvinced. He tells her that he's still in love with Greenlee and that being with Kendall is not right.

• Erica tries to convince Zach not to give up on his marriage to Kendall. Zach believes that Kendall is in love with Ryan and that their marriage is over. Erica thinks that Zach is running away from his problems and that he doesn't deserve to be unhappy. Zach disagrees, saying that he's just facing reality.

• J.R. is in jail, and Jesse is interrogating him about his father's whereabouts. J.R. claims that his father is in the hospital, but Jesse is skeptical. J.R. demands to know why he's being held and why his son is in foster care. Jesse tells him that he's being held for kidnapping and that the judge will decide what happens to his son.

• David visits Krystal in the hospital and apologizes for not being there sooner. Krystal is upset that he didn't call her, but David claims that he was at the police station and had his phone turned off. Krystal is worried about Little A and wants to know what's happening with the custody hearing. David reassures her that they will get their grandson back.

• Opal is struggling to cope with Greenlee's death and is having trouble sleeping. She believes that Greenlee's soul

<summary>
• Annie Lavery becomes agitated when Aidan Devane tells her that Tori, a person she claims is her friend, does not exist, leading to a sedation and observation by Dr. Burke.
• Adam Chandler, who is supposed to be in the hospital, sneaks out to visit Erica Kane, revealing that he is hiding something about his health and seeking her help.
• J.R. Chandler and Tad Martin search for Adam after his car is found abandoned and damaged, eventually finding him at Erica's place.
• David Hayward is anxious to operate on Ian Slater, Zach and Kendall's son, who needs heart surgery, and is relieved when the operation is successful.
• Colby Chandler searches for her missing father, Adam, with the help of Pete Cortlandt, while J.R. tries to keep her from getting involved due to the risk of the police following her.
• Annie Lavery remembers a traumatic event from her past involving a girl named Tori, who went missing around her seventh birthday, and Aidan suspects that Annie may have been involved in Tori's disappearance.
• The episode ends with Kendall and Zach watching over their recovering son, Ian, while Reese and Ryan have a tense conversation about Bianca and their past relationships.</summary>

<summary>
* The wedding of Angie and Jesse is disrupted by Robert Gardner, who shoots at the guests and takes Angie hostage. Jesse manages to overpower Robert and save Angie, but not before Robert shoots Tad. Tad is badly injured and requires immediate medical attention.

* Meanwhile, Greenlee discovers that her fiancé Aidan has been having an affair with her best friend Kendall. Greenlee is devastated and feels betrayed by the people she trusts the most. She lashes out at Zach, who tries to comfort her.

* Julia is shot during the chaos at the wedding and is rushed to the hospital. Despite the doctors' best efforts, Julia's injuries are too severe, and she dies after saying goodbye to her loved ones. Krystal is left to break the news to Julia's daughter Kathy.

* As the episode ends, Jesse and Angie share a romantic moment on the roof, while Frankie and Jake rush Tad to the hospital in a helicopter. Greenlee turns to Zach for comfort and kisses him, leaving her future with Aidan uncertain. The fate of Tad and Julia hangs in the balance as the episode comes to a close.</summary>

<summary>
• Erica confronts Ethan about his lies, specifically about Zach Slater's innocence, and warns him that Kendall will eventually see him for what he truly is. Ethan insists that he loves Kendall and plans to ask her to marry him, despite Erica's disapproval.

• Greenlee and Kendall argue over Ethan's character, with Greenlee claiming that Ethan is a liar and doesn't truly love Kendall. Kendall refuses to believe Greenlee and insists that Ethan loves her.

• Jack and Reggie discuss the case against Zach Slater, with Jack revealing that the DA is still determined to nail Slater for Edmund's murder. Reggie agrees to help Jack investigate and gather evidence.

• Braden is shown to be unstable and violent, with Jonathan trying to calm him down and convince him to leave town. Braden reveals that he wants to hurt Ryan and make him pay for past mistakes.

• Lily tells Reggie that she saw Braden kill Edmund, and Jack warns Greenlee to be careful because Braden is still on the loose. Greenlee is worried about Ryan's safety and tells Jack to be careful.

• Kendall tries to convince Lily to retract her statement about seeing Braden kill Edmund, but Lily insists that she is telling the truth. Reggie and Jack defend Lily and tell Kendall to leave her alone.

• Zach asks Livia to take his case and prove his innocence, while Ethan makes a phone call to discuss Erica Kane. The scene ends with a cliffhanger, setting up future conflicts and plot twists.</summary>

<summary>
• Taylor visits Dr. Franklin Hubbard for a foot exam, but instead meets Dr. Jake Martin, who diagnoses her with plantar fasciitis and prescribes anti-inflammatories.
• J.R. Chandler discusses his plan to buy Fusion and have Babe run it with Krystal, who is hesitant but ultimately supportive of the idea.
• Adam Chandler and Barry plot to take down Fusion by targeting its leadership, Kendall and Greenlee, and exploiting their personal lives and criminal histories.
• Randi Morgan, the new assistant at Fusion, is discovered to be a potential model, but she is hesitant due to her past experiences and fear of being recognized.
• Frankie Hubbard tries to protect Randi from her past, specifically from a man named Fletcher who is threatening her and demanding payment.
• Annie Lavery quits her job at Fusion after a confrontation with Kendall and Greenlee, but not before revealing that she has a hidden key, which Kendall has made a copy of.</summary>

<summary>
• Jamie is arrested and charged with possession with intent, but claims he was trying to take down a drug dealer who had been pushing to kids. Tad is skeptical of Jamie's story and thinks he may be protecting someone.
• Kendall tries to hire Bobby to seduce Greenlee as part of a plan to break up Greenlee and Ryan's marriage, offering him $50,000 to do so. Bobby agrees to the plan, but only if he can get hazard pay for the risk involved.
• David tries to convince Krystal to help him be a better father to Babe, but Krystal is hesitant due to David's past behavior. David eventually wins Krystal over by promising to be genuine in his efforts to connect with Babe.
• J.R. reveals to Babe that he knows the drug dealer who may have been involved in her drugging, and that he thinks the dealer may have been trying to get back at him. Babe is concerned about Jamie's involvement with the dealer and whether he may be using drugs.
• Kendall and Ryan have a confrontation on the roof, with Kendall trying to manipulate Ryan into giving in to his feelings for her. Ryan warns Kendall to stay away from Greenlee and his brother, threatening to take action if she tries to hurt anyone he cares about.</summary>

<summary>
• Jesse surprises Angie with a hotel room, which he refers to as their honeymoon suite, and they share a romantic evening together.
• Jack and Zach discuss Erica's case and try to figure out her next move, with Jack expressing concern about her safety.
• Erica, Carmen, and Louisa have a tense conversation, with Erica trying to convince Louisa to participate in her reality show.
• Greenlee tries to convince Ryan to let her help him regain his memories, but he is hesitant and feels guilty about his past mistakes.
• Kendall and Aidan have a conversation about his proposal to Greenlee, which she rejected, and Kendall tries to reassure him that Greenlee will come back to him.
• Annie decides to file for divorce from Ryan, citing the difficulties of living with his memory loss and the need to move forward for their daughter's sake.
• Erica reveals her plan to Louisa and Mando, offering them a chance to participate in her reality show and start a new life.
• Jack and Zach review the security footage from Armando's mother's apartment and discover that Erica and Carmen are on their way there.
• Kendall and Aidan have a heart-to-heart conversation, with Aidan apologizing for putting Kendall in an awkward position with Annie and Kendall reassuring him that everything will work out.
• The scene ends with a cliffhanger, as Greenlee receives a mysterious phone call and Ryan tries to warn her about something, while Louisa and Mando react to a sudden noise and Erica is referred to as "one hot mama."</summary>

<summary>
• Erica is visited by Adam, who reveals that he has found Tad's missing daughter, Kate, and that she is actually Julia's daughter, Kathy. Adam claims that he was haunted by Dixie's spirit, who told him to reveal the truth to Tad. Erica is skeptical and angry, feeling that Adam's actions were despicable. Adam tries to justify his behavior, but Erica is unconvinced.

• Tad is recovering in the hospital and is eager to see his daughter, Kate. Krystal tries to reassure him that everything will be okay, but Tad is still angry with Adam for keeping the truth from him. Krystal reveals that Adam had offered her a deal to tell Tad where Kate was if she divorced him. Tad is upset that Krystal didn't tell him about the deal.

• Ryan is struggling to come to terms with his past and his feelings for Annie. He confides in Greenlee, who is still hurting from their past relationship. Ryan reveals that he has remembered some things about Annie, but is unsure if his feelings for her are real. Greenlee tries to offer him support and advice.

• Annie is visiting a doctor, who reveals that she has a problem with ovulation and may need to take medication to get pregnant. Annie is desperate to have a child and is willing to do whatever it takes. The doctor warns her about the potential side effects of the medication, but Annie is undeterred. She is determined to have a child with her husband.

• J.R. is angry with his father, Adam, for his actions and feels that he needs to take revenge. He confides in Babe, who tries to calm him down and persuade him not to do anything rash. J.R. is still hurt by Richie's betrayal and feels that he needs to take action. Babe tries to warn him about the dangers of seeking revenge.

• Greenlee is trying to move on from her past relationship with Ryan and is focusing on her career. She has an interview with Kendall, but is still hurting from Ryan's rejection. Ryan tries to reassure her that she will be okay and that she can move on. Greenlee is determined to be strong and to find happiness again.</summary>

<summary>
• Erica is being held captive by a man who is working for Jane, who is impersonating Erica. Erica tries to reason with the man, but he is unmoved. The man receives a call from Jane, who is upset and trying to compose herself.

• Kendall is holding Ricky at gunpoint, but he is trying to manipulate her into not shooting him. Ricky claims that he did everything for Kendall and that he loves her. Kendall is furious and wants to kill Ricky for what he did to Zach.

• Bianca is remembering her ordeal with Ricky and Michael Cambias, and she is clearly traumatized. Jack is trying to comfort her and reassure her that everything will be okay. Bianca is worried about Kendall and wants to make sure she is safe.

• J.R. is trying to comfort Marissa, who is shaken by her experience with Ricky. Marissa is grateful for J.R.'s support, but she is also wary of his motives. J.R. is trying to be genuine and help Marissa, but she is not sure if she can trust him.

• Tad is trying to convince Liza to reopen the investigation into Diana Holden's murder and Zach's death. Liza is hesitant, but Tad is convinced that Ricky is the killer and that Griffin is innocent. Tad's persistence eventually pays off, and Liza agrees to reopen the case.

• Griffin arrives just in time to save Kendall from Ricky, and he is shot in the process. Ricky is arrested, and Griffin is taken into custody despite his heroism. Kendall is grateful to Griffin and promises to help him clear his name.

• The episode ends with several characters reflecting on the events of the day and looking forward to the future. Bianca is safe, and Kendall is finally able to start the healing process. Griffin is in custody, but he is hopeful that he will be exonerated and able to return to his life.</summary>

<summary>

<summary>

Scott is supportive and wants to give her the wedding of her dreams. Annie's divorce from Adam Chandler is not yet finalized, but she is eager to move forward with her life.

Scott tells J.R. to mind his own business, and J.R. responds by saying that he needs to discuss something with Scott. J.R. mentions that his wife Marissa is taking the bar exam and asks Scott not to bother her.

• Greenlee and Krystal have a conversation about David, and Krystal warns Greenlee about his manipulative behavior. Greenlee defends David and says that she trusts him. Krystal advises Greenlee to be careful and not to let David control her.

• Ryan and David have a confrontation, and David accuses Ryan of trying to win Greenlee back.

<summary>

<summary>

• Angie and Jesse reminisce about their past, with Jesse sharing stories about his friendship with Jenny. Angie is touched by Jesse's words, and they both acknowledge the power of their love. Jesse is grateful for their life together.

• The episode ends with a series of cliffhangers, including Adam's vow to protect J.R., Greenlee's determination to win back Aidan, and Kendall's guilt over sleeping with Aidan. The stage is set for more drama and tension in the next episode. The characters are all navigating complex relationships and personal struggles. The episode ends on a dramatic note, leaving viewers eager for more.
</summary>

<summary>

<summary>

She enlists the help of Tom, her husband, and they work together to try and defuse the situation. Meanwhile, Emily and Paul's relationship is put to the test as Mick reveals secrets about their past.

Casey and Alison's relationship is left uncertain, and the group is left to deal with the aftermath of the traumatic event. Wyatt is also getting his band removed, but he is experiencing more pain and discomfort than Steffy. Steffy tries to comfort Wyatt and make light of the situation. Ridge agrees to keep Quinn's secret and not tell Eric about their encounter. Quinn is grateful for Ridge's understanding and promises to respect his boundaries.

• Katie is concerned about Quinn's behavior and talks to Ivy about it. Ivy reveals that Quinn was acting strangely earlier and seemed upset. Katie wonders if Quinn is mad at her for spending time with Eric while Quinn was away. Ivy reassures Katie that Quinn hasn't mentioned anything, but Katie is still unsure.

• Steffy finally arrives at Liam's place, apologizing for her tardiness and explaining that she lost track of time. Liam is overjoyed to see her and relieved that she is finally free from her marriage to Wyatt. Steffy presents Liam with the final divorce papers, and they share a romantic moment, declaring their love for each other. Liam is ecstatic, and Steffy is happy to be with him at last.</summary>

<summary>

* Brooke reaches out to Bill's office but decides not to leave a message, instead choosing to call him later, and Eric continues to offer his support and listening ear to Brooke as she navigates her struggles.
* Steffy gets stuck in traffic due to an accident on PCH and decides to wait it out in her car, while Hope stays behind at the office, and the scene ends with a dramatic and intense sequence of events set to the song "Born to be Wild".</summary>

<summary>
• Katie is in the hospital with heart failure due to myocarditis, and her family is worried about her condition. Her doctor, Dr. Meade, has given her anti-inflammatories and drained excess fluid, but she has not responded yet.

• The events leading up to Katie's hospitalization are unclear, but it is revealed that Bill was involved in a car accident and went to Brooke's house to avoid the police. Brooke hid Bill in her bedroom to protect him from Lieutenant Baker, who was investigating the accident.

• Donna is suspicious of Brooke and Bill's actions and confronts them about what really happened. Brooke and Bill claim that nothing happened between them, but Donna is not convinced.

• Taylor, Katie's therapist, is also suspicious of Brooke and Bill's actions and accuses them of causing Katie's stress and distraction, which may have led to her missing her medication and developing myocarditis. Bill denies any wrongdoing, but Taylor is determined to find out the truth.</summary>

<summary>
• Carly is struggling with her emotions after being diagnosed with a brain tumor, and her son Parker is trying to find a way to save her life. Parker discovers an experimental treatment in Berlin, but it's expensive and not guaranteed to work.

• Luke is excited about the possibility of things working out between him and Noah, and Noah's father, Colonel Mayer, has had a change of heart and is now accepting of Noah's relationship with Luke. Colonel Mayer wants to make amends and spend time with Noah and Luke.

• Rosanna is dealing with the aftermath of lying under oath to protect Craig, and Paul is upset with her for not being honest with him. Rosanna is worried that she will lose Paul if he finds out the truth.

• Craig is trying to convince Meg to fully commit to their marriage, but Meg is still having doubts about him. Craig gives Meg an ultimatum, telling her to decide whether she's with him or not.

• Dusty is injured and being taken care of by Sly, who is trying to get in touch with Lily Snyder to get paid for his services. Dusty tells Sly to give a message to Lily, telling her where to find him.

• Rosanna visits Carly and tells her about her problems with Paul, and Carly advises her to be honest with him. Rosanna is worried about losing Paul to Meg, and Carly tells her to take care of the problem.

• Craig meets with Rosanna and she tells him to get Meg pregnant to keep her from going after Paul. Craig is hesitant at first, but eventually agrees to try.

• Carly tells Parker that the treatment in Berlin won't work for her, and Parker is upset and wants to keep looking for a cure. Carly tries to convince Parker to accept her fate and make the most of the time they have left.

• Colonel Mayer is confronted by Sly, who accuses him of shooting Dusty and leaving him for dead. Colonel Mayer denies knowing Dusty, but Sly is not convinced.
</summary>

<summary>

<summary>

Ridge is hesitant, citing the complicated history between Brooke and Taylor, as well as Brooke's past relationship with Nick. Brooke believes that Jack can bring them together and that they can put their differences aside.

Marlena is still feeling guilty about her past betrayal of her husband with Tony.

• Roman and Kate are having a disagreement about Roman's jealousy of Tony Dimera. Kate thinks Roman is jealous because he has feelings for her, but Roman denies it. Kate reveals that she was having a great time with Tony and that Roman can't stand it. Roman accuses Kate of using Tony to get back at him.

• Rex is talking to Professor Rolf, who reveals that he is the doctor who delivered Rex and his sister Cassie. Rolf explains that Stefano Dimera wanted to create perfect twins and that he was the facilitator of the experiment. Rex is surprised and wants to know more about the experiment and why Stefano wanted to create them.

• Kate reveals to Roman that she used to sell her services to men for money when she was younger and desperate to survive. She is worried that Roman will not want her anymore after hearing this. Roman reassures her that he still wants her and that her past does not matter to him. Kate is relieved and happy.

• Belle and Shawn-D are being playful and romantic, with Belle trying to prove that she can be wild and crazy. They end up getting messy and having fun together. Meanwhile, John is still upset about Tony and Marlena's relationship, and Marlena is trying to reassure him that she loves him and only him. Rex is planning something big and is excited to make his presence felt in Salem.</summary>

<summary>
* Daniel and Maxine discuss their day, and Maxine mentions that Jennifer will be in shortly, but Anne Milbauer is not present.

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>
