He is also dealing with his own emotions and is struggling to come to terms with the loss of Georgie. Max is trying to help Spinelli but is also worried about the health inspector's visit to the coffee shop.

* The health inspector arrives at the coffee shop and is not happy with what he finds. Diane tries to smooth things over and offers to pay any fines that may be incurred. The inspector is eventually placated and leaves, but not before Diane asks for his fashion advice.

* Jerry is planning to have Stanford Johnson killed because he is a liability and knows too much about his business dealings. Epiphany receives a call from Stanford but it is cut short when he is presumably killed. Tracy calls for help as Luke's heart monitor flatlines.</summary

<summary>
• Sonny visits Morgan's grave and talks to him about his mistakes, including sleeping with Nelle and lying to Carly about it. Carly arrives and they have a heart-to-heart conversation about their issues and Morgan's death. Carly is still hurt and angry, and Sonny apologizes for his mistakes. Carly tells Sonny that she needs time alone with Morgan and asks him to leave.

• Meanwhile, Jason and Curtis are trapped in an elevator with a bomb, and they work together to disarm it. Curtis uses his knowledge of wires to try and disable the bomb, while Jason provides support. They successfully disarm the bomb, but not before it explodes, and they are rescued. Jason is reunited with Sam and their newborn baby, Scout.

• Olivia Jerome is revealed to be alive and has been seeking revenge against her brother Julian. She kidnaps Alexis and forces Julian to choose between killing her or being killed himself. Julian refuses to kill Alexis, and Olivia threatens to kill her instead. Julian tries to reason with Olivia, but she is too far gone.

• The police are searching for Olivia, and Jordan is determined to find her. Curtis is also helping with the search and is concerned about Jordan's safety. Ava reveals that Olivia was at her house earlier and threatened her, and Carly vows to find Olivia and make her pay for Morgan's death. Sonny also wants revenge and orders his men to find Olivia and bring her to him.</summary>

<summary>
* Jason and Sam discuss the possibility that Nikolas staged his own death to escape his problems, and they suspect that Hayden may have been the intended target of the setup.
* Nathan confesses to Maxie that he shot his ex-wife's lover in a fit of jealousy, and Maxie is torn between her love for Nathan and her shock at his secret.
* Lucas tries to remember the details of his attack, but his memories are fuzzy, and the police investigation is ongoing.
* Hayden's mother, Naomi, arrives in town and reveals that she is looking for a valuable diamond necklace that Hayden's husband, Nikolas, sold one of the stones from.
* Jason receives news that a warrant has been issued for his arrest in connection with Nikolas' disappearance, and he and Sam go into hiding to try to clear his name.</summary>

<summary>
• Todd Manning is holding Sonny Corinthos at gunpoint, blaming him for the death of his granddaughter and her father, while Starr Manning tries to intervene. Sonny denies any involvement in the accident that killed them.

• Lieutenant John McBain arrives and tries to reason with Todd, eventually managing to disarm him and arrest him for jumping bail in Pennsylvania. Todd is taken away, vowing to make Sonny pay for what he's done.

• Meanwhile, Maxie Jones is struggling to cope with the loss of her cousin Robin Scorpio Drake, who died in a lab explosion. She confides in Dr. Ewen Keenan, who offers to help her process her grief.

• Johnny Zacchara is trying to manipulate Kate Howard into helping him take down Sonny Corinthos, but Kate is resistant to his charms. Johnny eventually reveals that he knows Kate's alter ego, Connie, and tries to use that to his advantage.

• Tracy Quartermaine is trying to convince Anthony Zacchara to leave the country, but Anthony is determined to clear his name and take down Sonny. Tracy eventually threatens to call Sonny and reveal Anthony's location.

• Carly Corinthos is trying to reason with Todd, but he is resolute in his desire for revenge against Sonny. Carly warns Todd that he is playing with fire and that Sonny is not a man to be trifled with.

• Michael Corinthos is trying to comfort Starr, who is struggling to come to terms with the loss of her family. Michael offers to help Starr get the truth about what happened to her family.

• Olivia Falconeri is trying to help Steve Webber deal with the fallout from his past mistakes, including pulling the plug on a patient in Memphis. Steve is being blackmailed by Johnny Zacchara, who wants him to help take down Sonny.

• Sonny is released on bail, but John McBain warns him that he will be keeping a close eye on him. Sonny is confident that he will be exonerated, but John is determined to bring him to justice.

• As the episode ends, Starr is seen looking at a photo of her family, while Michael looks on. The scene fades to black as the sound of a cell phone ringing can be heard in the background.</summary>

<summary>
• Alexis visits Jason and Sam, discussing the possibility of Sam getting pregnant and Jason's concerns about being a father again after losing Jake. Jason feels that his life is too dangerous for a child, but Alexis points out that he can't keep a child safe all the time. Jason's past decision to give up Jake is brought up, and Alexis wonders what has changed since then.

• Carly and Jax argue over custody of their daughter Josslyn, with Jax using a preliminary report to try and prove that Shawn is a threat to Josslyn's safety. Carly defends Shawn and accuses Jax of trying to bully her into giving up custody. Shawn quits his job as Josslyn's bodyguard, but later agrees to stay on after Carly asks for his help.

• Kristina confides in Michael about taking hydrocodone pills that were given to her by Lisa, and Michael promises to keep the secret from their mother Alexis. Kristina is struggling with feelings of guilt and shame, and Michael tries to reassure her that she didn't do anything wrong. Ethan is mentioned as someone who has been helping Kristina deal with her addiction.

• Brenda is struggling to connect with her son Alec and feels like she's hitting a wall with Sonny, who she feels is shutting her out of his life. She confides in Jax about her feelings and thanks Carly for helping to distract Alec while Suzanne was taken into custody. Meanwhile, Lisa is shown to be holding Robin captive in a basement, where she reveals her plan to frame Patrick for Robin's murder.</summary>

<summary>
*Nikolas breaks up with Rebecca, citing that he can't be with her because she reminds him of her twin sister Emily, whom he loved. Rebecca is hurt and feels that Nikolas never truly saw her as an individual. Monica, Emily's mother, tries to offer Rebecca some comfort and advice.
*Carly is struggling to let go of her overprotective tendencies towards Michael, who is recovering from a coma. Jax tries to help Carly see that she needs to give Michael space and trust him to take care of himself. Meanwhile, Michael is trying to assert his independence and prove to himself and others that he is capable of handling things on his own.
*Claudia is trying to protect herself and her unborn baby from Jason, who she believes is a threat to their safety. She enlists the help of her brother Johnny and their uncle Rudy to take care of Jason, and a plan is set in motion to ambush Jason. Johnny is hesitant to get involved, but ultimately agrees to help his sister.</summary>

<summary>
• Elizabeth informs Patrick that Ms. Gilbert is stable but her system is compromised due to the advanced state of the AIDS virus.
• Alan recommends that Patrick get tested for HIV and Hepatitis B and C after being exposed to the virus during a procedure.
• Sonny argues with Emily about his therapy session, where Dr. Lainey suggested that his mother was to blame for his stepfather's abuse.
• Carly intervenes and tells Sonny that he needs to take responsibility for his actions and work on his therapy.
• Nikolas thanks Alfred for introducing him to Emily, and they spend time together with Nikolas's son John.
• Sam is stuck in an elevator with Jason and opens up to him about her struggles, including her upcoming GED test.
• Lucky confides in Elizabeth that he didn't actually kill Manny, and that Jason was the one who threw him off the roof.
• Patrick begins taking anti-retroviral medication as a precaution after being exposed to the HIV virus.
• Carly confronts Sonny about his childhood and his mother's role in not protecting him from his abusive stepfather.
• Sonny begins to come to terms with his past and realizes that he needs to take responsibility for his actions and work on his therapy.</summary>

<summary>
* Maxie's condition is deteriorating, and her heart is failing, while Georgie is recovering from surgery. Maxie's family is by her side, and they are trying to stay positive, but the doctors are preparing them for the worst. Monica tells Mac and Felicia that Maxie's blood pressure is staying too low, and she is going into renal failure.

* Nikolas and Emily are struggling with their relationship, and Nikolas feels like he is hurting Emily more than helping her. Emily wants to put the past behind her and move forward with Nikolas, but she is still struggling with her feelings. Nikolas decides to give Emily space, but she tells him that she wants to be with him.

* Reese is being questioned by John Durant about her ex-husband's death, and Ric is trying to protect her. Reese reveals that she and Carly knew each other in high school, and Ric warns her that Carly might recognize her. Reese admits that she has resentment towards Carly, but claims that she is over it.

* Sonny is trying to get to the truth about Reese's past and her connection to Evan. Reese tells Sonny that she didn't want Evan to die, but she wanted him to leave her alone. Sonny is torn between trusting Reese and being cautious, and he tells her that he wants the truth.

* Carly is worried about Sonny's relationship with Reese and feels like something is off about her. Lorenzo tries to reassure Carly that she is just being paranoid, but Carly is convinced that Reese is hiding something. Carly and Lorenzo have a heart-to-heart about their own relationship and how they can work through their problems.

* Georgie wakes up from her coma and is told that Maxie's heart is failing. Georgie wants to see Maxie, and Dillon helps her get to her sister's room. Maxie is weak but happy to see Georgie, and the two sisters share a emotional goodbye, but Georgie refuses to say goodbye, and Maxie's heart stops beating.</summary>

<summary>
• Sam McCall leaves a message for Dr. Finn, asking him to call her back with her test results as soon as possible. She's concerned about the results affecting her decisions and is getting a little freaked out. She's worried about passing something along to her child.

• Kevin Collins is recovering from being shot and is feeling frustrated about being stuck in bed. Laura Spencer tries to reassure him, but he's determined to take a walk despite his injuries. Kevin thanks Laura for saving his life and cutting a bullet out of his shoulder.

• Ava Jerome is struggling to sleep and is angry about Scott Baldwin and Morgan Corinthos' plans to marry her daughter. She's surprised by a visit from Holt, who claims to have been worried about her. Ava denies being the head of the Jerome family and says she's out of the business.

• Julian Jerome is in prison and is visited by his attorney, Scott Baldwin. Julian is unhappy about being transferred to Pentonville and is still trying to come to terms with his situation. Scotty tells Julian that his stunt at the arraignment didn't work.

• Kristina Davis and Aaron are discussing their relationship and the fact that Kristina lied to him about her feelings for Parker. Kristina apologizes for being emotionally dishonest and hurting Aaron. Aaron is angry and hurt but wants to support Kristina as she figures out her feelings.

• Sam reveals to Elizabeth that she's pregnant, but she doesn't want to tell Jason yet because she's waiting for her test results to make sure the baby is okay. Elizabeth promises to keep the secret and offers to drive Sam to the hospital to get her test results. Sam is grateful for Elizabeth's support and kindness.</summary>

<summary>
• Patrick struggles to change Jake's diaper, while Robin teases him about his lack of experience with babies. Eventually, Patrick succeeds in changing the diaper, but not before Jake pees on him.

• Carly and Jax discuss the possibility of her being pregnant, but Carly is hesitant to take a pregnancy test, fearing that a positive result would be a painful reminder of her son Michael's condition. Jax is eager to have a child, but Carly is unsure if she's ready.

• Sonny and Kate discuss their upcoming wedding, but Kate brings up the topic of a prenuptial agreement, citing Sonny's past as a mobster and the potential risks to her assets. Sonny is hesitant, but Kate assures him that it's just a precaution.

• Maxie and Johnny are stuck in an elevator, and Maxie tries to flirt with him, but Johnny is resistant, citing his loyalty to Lulu. Maxie warns Johnny that Lulu is fragile and may not be able to handle the dangers of his family's business.

• Lulu and Logan have a confrontation, with Logan warning Lulu about the dangers of the Zacchara family and trying to persuade her to leave Johnny. Lulu refuses to listen, and Logan accuses her of being in denial.

• Jason and Claudia discuss Spinelli's condition, with Claudia warning Jason that Sonny may try to manipulate him into a confrontation. Jason is skeptical, but Claudia insists that Sonny's behavior is predictable.

• Patrick and Robin have a heart-to-heart about their future together, with Patrick expressing his reservations about having a child. Robin is understanding, but also encourages Patrick to consider the possibility of fatherhood.

• Lulu confronts Maxie about her behavior, accusing her of trying to sabotage her relationship with Johnny. Maxie claims that she's only trying to protect Lulu from herself, but Lulu is unconvinced.

• The scene ends with a series of cliffhangers, including Carly's revelation that she may be pregnant with either Jax's or Sonny's child, and Spinelli's dire warning to Jason about Sonny's intentions.</summary>

<summary>
* Franco is declared not guilty due to his tumor, and he is released from custody. He returns to the Quartermaine mansion, where he reveals that he poisoned the relish and announces that he is a changed man. Ava is furious and tries to use her knowledge of Franco's crimes to blackmail him, but he kicks her out of the house. Tracy also turns on Ava, firing her from her job at ELQ and giving her an hour to pack her things.

* Britt gives birth to her baby, but the child has fluid in his lungs and needs immediate medical attention. Sabrina delivers the baby and takes him to the hospital, where he receives treatment and recovers. Britt is frantic with worry, but Nikolas reassures her that the baby will be okay. When Britt finally sees her baby, she is overjoyed and grateful to Silas and Sabrina for their help.

* Morgan confesses to Sonny that he feels guilty for Connie's death, but Sonny reassures him that it's not his fault. Kiki and Michael have a heart-to-heart, and Michael apologizes for his past behavior towards Morgan. Michael also tells Kiki that he will support her and Morgan, no matter what. Meanwhile, TJ and Molly reunite, and Taylor is left to plot her next move.</summary>

<summary>
* The scene begins with Steve and an EMT discussing a patient with respiratory distress, while Patrick searches for Monica and Tracy tries to contact her family. Meanwhile, Jerry is trying to escape with Alexis, and Jax and Sonny are trying to stop him. Tracy is also trying to get the antiserum to her father, Edward.
* Dante and McBain are trying to defuse a bomb that Jerry has rigged to the antiserum, while Lulu arrives and tries to help them. They manage to disconnect the timer, but McBain stays behind to try and defuse the rest of the bomb. Meanwhile, Carly is with Johnny, who is injured and trying to confess something to her.
* Tracy steals the antiserum and gives it to her father, Edward, who then gives it to Emma, Patrick's daughter. Monica is furious, but Tracy is grateful to her father for saving Emma's life. Meanwhile, Jerry is trying to escape, but Jax and Sonny are closing in on him.
* The scene ends with McBain trying to defuse the bomb, while Jerry is shot by Sonny and Jax is injured. Tracy is saying goodbye to her father, who is at peace with his life and ready to be reunited with his loved ones. The fate of the characters is left uncertain as the scene ends with a cliffhanger.</summary>

<summary>
• Hayden confronts Nikolas about his knowledge of Jake's identity, but Nikolas denies any involvement. Hayden is skeptical and believes Nikolas is hiding something. Nikolas claims he was only trying to protect Jake from Hayden's fake marriage scheme. Hayden is not convinced and continues to press Nikolas for answers.

• Meanwhile, Anna discovers that Sloane has been working for Nikolas and did not follow through on their plan to take down Nikolas. Anna is disappointed and feels betrayed by Sloane's actions. Sloane tries to justify his decision, but Anna is not interested. She tells Sloane that she was considering exploring a relationship with him, but now she's not sure.

• Carly is getting ready for her wedding to Sonny, but he is nowhere to be found. Maxie is trying to keep everything under control, but it's clear that something is amiss. Carly is trying to stay calm and believes that Sonny will show up eventually. Morgan is getting worried and tries to call Sonny, but he's not answering.

• Sonny has been shot and is being treated by paramedics. Jason and Sam are with him, trying to keep him calm and stable. TJ is feeling guilty for getting Sonny into this situation and is worried that he might not make it. The paramedics are trying to get Sonny to the hospital as quickly as possible.

• As the wedding ceremony is about to start, Jason arrives with blood on his shirt and a somber expression. Carly is immediately concerned and asks what's going on. The scene ends with a cliffhanger, leaving the audience wondering what will happen next. The medic is heard saying that Sonny is barely stable and needs to be moved to the hospital. Carly's world is about to be turned upside down.</summary>

<summary>
• Tracy insists on accompanying Luke on his mission to find Jerry Jacks, who has the cure for Luke's polonium 210 poisoning. Luke is hesitant, citing the danger and Tracy's responsibilities at ELQ. Tracy argues that she can help and that finding Jerry is like finding a needle in a haystack. Luke eventually agrees, and Tracy starts packing.

• Lulu reveals to Laura and Nikolas that she and Dante have found out the sex of their baby, and it's a girl. Laura is overjoyed and can't wait to start shopping for baby clothes. Nikolas is also happy and congratulates Lulu and Dante. Lulu thanks them for their support.

• AJ tries to convince Michael to stay away from Kiki, citing their familial relationship. Michael is struggling with his feelings for Kiki and asks AJ to send him out of the country. AJ refuses, saying he needs Michael's help at ELQ. Michael is torn between his loyalty to AJ and his attraction to Kiki.

• Carly is blackmailed by Franco into letting Morgan stay with him and Ava. Franco threatens to reveal Carly's alleged involvement in his shooting unless she agrees. Carly reluctantly agrees, but warns Franco and Ava that she will figure out their game and take action. Ava and Franco celebrate their victory.

• Shawn reveals to Alexis that he didn't shoot Olivia, but Alexis is still upset about his job as a hitman. Shawn argues that he's not a mindless killer, but Alexis is unconvinced. She tells Shawn that she can't be with him unless he quits working for Sonny. Shawn agrees to her terms.

• Nikolas and Elizabeth discuss AJ's infidelity, and Nikolas reveals that he didn't tell Elizabeth about AJ's relationship with Carly because he didn't want to get involved. Elizabeth is upset that Nikolas didn't defend AJ, but Nikolas argues that he was trying to stay out of it. Elizabeth is torn between her feelings for AJ and Nikolas.

• Luke writes a note to Tracy, telling her that he's changed his mind and doesn't want her to come with him. He says that he's counting on her to keep his mission a secret. Tracy is unaware of the note and continues to pack. Luke's intentions are unclear.

• Ava and Franco discuss their plan, and Ava reveals that she may have been involved in the second shooting. Franco is suspicious, but Ava denies any involvement. The truth about the shootings remains unclear. Ava and Franco's relationship is complex and potentially volatile

<summary>
* Sonny helps Alexis, who is feeling unwell, and her daughter Kristina. Alexis is stressed about her job as the district attorney and her marriage to Ric. Sonny offers his support and advice, telling her to be honest with Ric about her needs.

* Emily visits Nikolas and brings a prescription for Spencer's ear infection. Nikolas is grateful, and Emily teases him about Alfred's cooking. Lucky arrives, drunk and upset, and asks Nikolas to take care of Elizabeth and Cameron.

* Elizabeth visits Jason, who is drinking alone, and tells him that Lucky is having an affair with Maxie. Jason reveals that Sam slept with Ric, and Elizabeth is shocked. Jason offers Elizabeth a drink, and they commiserate about their relationships.

* Ric tries to justify his actions to Sam, who is angry and hurt. Sam accuses Ric of using her to get revenge on Jason, and Ric denies it. Sam threatens to tell Jason about their affair.

* Lulu tells Dillon that she is leaving Port Charles and wants to travel. Dillon is skeptical, but Lulu insists that she needs a change. Lulu also reveals that she still cares about Dillon and values their friendship.

* Lucky's addiction to pain pills is revealed, and Nikolas and Emily try to stage an intervention. Lucky becomes defensive and angry, and Nikolas tells him to leave. Lulu tries to help Lucky, but he pushes her away.

* Alexis confides in Sonny about her marriage problems with Ric. Sonny advises her to be honest with Ric about her needs and to communicate openly. Alexis is hesitant, but Sonny encourages her to take a chance.

* Sam confronts Ric about their affair and accuses him of using her. Ric tries to justify his actions, but Sam is unforgiving. Sam threatens to tell Jason about their affair, and Ric tries to stop her.

* Elizabeth and Jason grow closer as they talk about their relationships. Elizabeth reveals that she has feelings for Jason, but he is hesitant to reciprocate. Jason offers Elizabeth a place to stay, and she accepts.

* Ric tries to manipulate Sonny into helping him, but Sonny sees through his schemes. Sonny tells Ric to take care of his family and to stop chasing after Jason. Ric is angry, but Sonny stands firm.
</summary>

<summary>
• TJ is in trouble and needs Molly's help, as he has messed up Sonny and Carly's wedding cake. Molly agrees to help him fix the cake, and they start brainstorming ways to salvage it.

• Sonny and Carly are preparing for their wedding day, with Sonny working on his vows and Carly getting ready with the help of her friends and family. Meanwhile, Morgan shows up at Sonny's house, drunk and upset about his recent break-up with Kiki.

• Michael is struggling with whether or not to attend Sonny and Carly's wedding, as he is still hurt by Sonny's past actions. Sabrina tries to convince him to go, but Michael is unsure if he can forgive Sonny and pretend everything is okay.

• Anna returns to Port Charles and visits Patrick and Emma, bringing a gift for Emma to cheer her up on her first day of school. Emma is initially resistant to going to school, but eventually gets ready with Sam's help.

• Nikolas and Hayden discuss their plans for the day, with Nikolas suggesting they stay home and relax together. Hayden agrees, and they start making plans for a fun day at home.

• Spencer is getting ready for his first day of school, and is determined to win Emma back. He talks to his father, Nikolas, about his plans and asks for his advice.

• Molly and TJ work together to fix the wedding cake, using a new frosting recipe and decorating it with fresh flowers. They eventually succeed in creating a beautiful cake, and TJ is grateful for Molly's help.

• Jason visits Carly on her wedding day, bringing her flowers and offering his support. Carly confides in him about her concerns for Morgan, who may be struggling with bipolar disorder.

• Sam and Anna discuss their plan to take down Nikolas and get Michael the evidence he needs to regain control of ELQ. Anna agrees to meet with Kyle Sloane and get him to testify against Nikolas, and Sam is grateful for her help.
</summary>

<summary>
*Ava is trying to get a flash drive from Scott, which contains a recording that could put her in jail for Connie's murder. Scott claims the drive was stolen, but Ava doesn't believe him and demands he find it. Ava is worried that Ric Lansing will use the recording to charge her with the crime. She threatens to withhold the $5 million she owes Scott unless he retrieves the drive.
*Paul Hornsby uses his past relationship with Mayor Janice Lomax to get a cease and desist order lifted, allowing his son Dillon's movie production to continue. Paul's charm and influence over the mayor are evident, and he is able to get what he wants. Dillon is grateful to his father for saving his movie. Paul's actions are seen as a positive step in his efforts to make amends for past mistakes.
*Morgan Corinthos is on the hunt for Julian Jerome, who he believes shot his father Sonny. Morgan is armed and determined to stop Julian before he can harm his father again. Michael Corinthos is trying to find Morgan and stop him before he does something reckless. Meanwhile, Kristina is worried about her mother Alexis, who is with Julian and may be in danger.</summary>

<summary>
* Claudia is set to marry Sonny Corinthos as part of a business deal between their families, despite her brother Johnny's disapproval. Johnny is worried about Claudia's safety and the potential consequences of the marriage. Claudia believes the marriage will benefit her and strengthen her family's position. She also claims to be doing it for Johnny's sake, to secure his future in the organization.
* Meanwhile, Jason Morgan is dealing with the aftermath of a warehouse fire and the shooting of three men, and is suspected of arson and murder. Elizabeth and her sons are staying at a cabin, where they are eventually found by the Russians. Sam tries to protect them, but they are cut off from the outside world with no phone signal. Jason is arrested and charged with the crimes, while Elizabeth and the boys are in danger from the Russians.</summary>

<summary>
• Gus discovers he has a 16-year-old son, Rafe, with Natalia, a secret she kept from him for years, and struggles to come to terms with the revelation.
• Beth tries to navigate her complicated relationships with Alan, Rick, and her daughter Lizzie, while also dealing with her pregnancy and the pressure from Alan to prepare for the baby's arrival.
• Reva confronts Alan about his deceitful actions, including a bounced check for cancer research, and warns him that she will not back down.
• Meanwhile, Daisy and Rafe bond over their shared experiences in juvenile detention, and Harley tries to offer support to Gus as he navigates his newfound fatherhood.</summary>

<summary>
• Maxie is struggling to cope with the loss of her daughter, who was taken away from her due to her being deemed unfit as a mother. She is trying to stay strong and focus on the fact that her daughter is safe and loved.

• Spinelli is considering moving to Portland with his girlfriend Ellie and Maxie's daughter, as Ellie has landed her dream job there. Maxie has given her blessing for them to go, but Spinelli is torn between his love for Ellie and his loyalty to his friends and family in Port Charles.

• Franco has killed his mother, Heather Webber, in self-defense after she threatened to harm his girlfriend Carly. He is struggling to come to terms with what he has done and is seeking help from Dr. Kevin Collins.

• Lulu is grieving the loss of her daughter and is angry with her husband Dante for not backing her up in court. She feels that he is responsible for them losing custody of their daughter and is pushing him away.

• Carly is trying to help Lulu and Dante heal and move forward, but Lulu is resistant to her efforts. Carly is also trying to help Franco, who is struggling to find a job and redeem himself after his past mistakes.

• Dr. Kevin Collins has agreed to take Franco on as a patient and help him work through his issues. Franco is hoping to use therapy to become a better person and prove himself to Carly, who he loves and wants to be with.</summary>

<summary>
• Lizzie reveals to Ava that she knows Ava went to a fertility clinic, and Ava is forced to leave after Bill tells her to get out.
• Rick is struggling to come to terms with his anniversary and the cancellation of the Bauer barbecue, but Beth tries to convince him to attend the rescheduled event at Josh and Cassie's house.
• Bill and Ava's marriage is put to the test as Bill's true feelings for Lizzie are revealed, and Ava discovers that Bill knows the baby is not his.
• Lizzie and Alan decide to start a new tradition and have a picnic, but their plans are ruined when Alan falls and gets hurt.
• The Bauer barbecue goes ahead at Josh and Cassie's house, with Rick eventually attending and even giving a speech.
• Bill and Ava put on a united front at the barbecue, but the tension between them is palpable.
• Remy confronts Ava about the baby's paternity, and Ava tries to justify her actions.
• The episode ends with a sense of hope and renewal as the characters come together to celebrate the Fourth of July and look to the future.</summary>

<summary>
*Cassie and Jeffrey discuss their relationship and RJ's upcoming party, while Edmund tries to cause tension between them.
*Edmund visits Dinah and tries to convince her to sleep with him, but she is hesitant and wants him to turn himself in for kidnapping her.
*Reva discovers that Nate, Jonathan's adoptive father, is in town and is likely responsible for the death of Olivia's sister.
*Jonathan and Tammy have a confrontation, and Sandy breaks up with Tammy due to her constant doubts and obsession with Jonathan.
*Edmund offers to supervise RJ's party so that Cassie can attend an awards ceremony with Jeffrey, but Cassie is suspicious of his motives.
*Dinah agrees to tell Cassie that Edmund did not kidnap her in exchange for sex with Edmund.
*Reva tries to protect Jonathan from Nate and later asks Nate for her old job back at the bar, claiming she has a new perspective.
*The episode ends with a preview of the next episode, which includes Lizzie and Mel's relationship, Harley's disappearance, and Alan's guilt over Sebastian's actions.</summary>

<summary>
• Alexis and Ric discuss their plans to cut down a Christmas tree, but Ric is hesitant and would rather buy one from a lot. Alexis insists on continuing the family tradition of cutting down a tree in the woods where Molly was conceived.

• Carly is determined to leave Roselawn and return home to her children for Christmas, but Dr. Kim and Lainey are opposed to the idea, citing her emotional instability. Carly threatens to leave anyway, but Dr. Kim warns her that he will get a restraining order to keep her away from her children.

• Nikolas apologizes to Courtney and Nikolas for his behavior the other night and suggests they resolve their differences in a more civilized manner. Courtney visits Carly at Roselawn and finds her upset about not being able to leave for Christmas.

• Sonny receives a call from Carly, who informs him that she won't be able to come home for Christmas. Sonny tries to reassure Michael and Morgan that they will still have a great Christmas without their mother.

• Alexis is appointed to defend Manny Ruiz, despite her initial reluctance and personal connection to the case. She visits Manny in the hospital and is surprised to find that he is remorseful for his actions and wants to apologize to his victims.

• Courtney offers to fill in for Carly on Christmas and spend time with the boys, but Sonny is hesitant due to her relationship with Nikolas. Emily returns to Sonny's house to help with the boys and decorate the Christmas tree.

• The episode ends with a heartwarming scene of Sonny, Emily, Michael, and Morgan decorating the Christmas tree and enjoying each other's company, while Carly looks on longingly from Roselawn. The scene is set to the music of "Silent Night".
</summary>

<summary>
• Alan Spaulding confesses to shooting his son Phillip, but tries to justify his actions as a means to protect his family. However, his family members are horrified by his admission and turn against him. The police arrive and arrest Alan, who is taken away in handcuffs. As he is led away, Gus tells him that he will never forgive him for trying to frame Harley for the crime.

• Meanwhile, Edmund is struggling to come to terms with the loss of his unborn child with Dinah, and is desperate to hold on to Cassie and their baby. However, Cassie is determined to keep Edmund away from their child, citing his violent tendencies as a reason. Edmund tries to convince Cassie to give him another chance, but she is resolute in her decision. Dinah, who is still reeling from her miscarriage, tries to manipulate Edmund into staying with her.

• Tammy and Sandy's relationship is on the rocks, with Tammy struggling to come to terms with her feelings for Jonathan. Sandy tries to move on and starts talking to another woman, April, but Tammy is determined to win him back. Jonathan, who is watching the scene unfold, is amused by Tammy's antics and warns April to stay away from Sandy. As the scene ends, Reva accuses Jonathan of killing Olivia's sister, setting the stage for a dramatic confrontation.</summary>

<summary>
* The scene opens with Michael expressing his nervousness about public speaking at Sonny's wedding, while Starr tries to reassure him. Max and Milo discuss the security arrangements for the wedding. Meanwhile, Johnny is seen arguing with Connie, who is revealed to be Kate's alter ego. Olivia tries to warn Dante and Steve about Connie's true identity.

* Elizabeth confesses to Jason that she lied about the DNA test results, revealing that Sam's baby is actually alive. Jason is shocked and demands to know why Elizabeth lied. • Meanwhile, Malcolm Winters is anxiously waiting for the results of a paternity test that could reveal whether he is the father of Lily Winters. Drucilla Winters is trying to keep the test a secret, but Phyllis Summers has discovered the truth and is threatening to expose it.

• Victor meets with the bankers who hold Jabot's debt and offers to buy the debt himself, which would prevent Nick from taking over the company. The bankers agree to sell the debt to Victor, and Nick is left feeling humiliated and betrayed by his father's actions.</summary>

<summary>
* Detective Chance informs the Newman family that the body found in the Athletic Club's basement is Adam's, and they have a search warrant for the Newman ranch.
* Jack Abbott is shocked to learn that his wife Patty is pregnant, and he struggles to come to terms with the news.
* Lauren Fenmore is being held captive by Ryder and Daisy, who are revealed to be working for Sheila Carter, Lauren's arch-nemesis.
* The police investigation into Adam's murder continues, with Owen Pomerantz questioning the Newman family and searching for evidence.
* Phyllis Newman tries to protect her husband Nick by hiding a jacket with a bloodstain, which she fears may be connected to Adam's murder.
* The episode ends with Lauren confronting Sheila, who is revealed to be alive and manipulating her children to carry out her revenge against Lauren.</summary>

<summary>
* Daniel is struggling with the consequences of his actions, feeling guilty and responsible for Cassie's accident, and is considering leaving Genoa City to escape the situation.
* Meanwhile, relationships are being tested as Phyllis tries to balance her work and personal life, Lauren confronts Michael about his lack of communication, and Mac tries to navigate her feelings for J.T.
* Cassie's health is improving, and she begins to remember fragments of the accident, including the fact that she was driving the car, which could have significant implications for Daniel's case.</summary>

<summary>
• Karen and Colleen discuss a patient's medication, and Karen agrees to decrease the dosage and draw another level in 12 hours. Kevin interrupts, seeking help with his addiction, and Karen offers to help him find treatment. Kevin reveals that he has been taking a mysterious substance that Joshua told him was vitamins and herbs. Karen is skeptical and refuses to give Kevin the ingredients, knowing he wants to make more of the substance.

• Ian and Chris discuss Ian's increasing need for blood, and Chris agrees to provide more. Ian reveals that he is struggling not to feed on Lucy, and Chris offers to help him. Chris warns Ian that he is putting his own life at risk by helping him. Ian thanks Chris for his help and promises to be careful.

• Lucy and Elizabeth discuss Alison's disappearance, and Elizabeth asks for Lucy's help in finding her. Lucy is hesitant, feeling useless without her slayer powers. Elizabeth encourages Lucy to use her intuition and instincts to help find Alison. Lucy agrees to try and use her tarot cards and crystal ball to locate Alison.

• Joshua and Alison have a tense conversation, and Alison accuses Joshua of being obsessed with her family. Joshua reveals that he and Alison's father were friends, but their friendship ended when Joshua realized he would never be accepted as an equal. Joshua claims that he did not kill Alison's father, but Alison is skeptical. Joshua's motives for keeping Alison captive are still unclear.

• Jamal and Stacey have a confrontation, and Rafe intervenes, seeking information about Alison's whereabouts. Jamal refuses to cooperate, and Rafe attacks him. Lisa finds Jamal injured and offers to help him. Jamal refuses, insisting that he is fine.

• Kevin and Karen have a heated argument about his addiction, and Karen refuses to give him the ingredients for the substance. Kevin becomes desperate and begs Karen for help. Karen offers to help Kevin find a treatment program, but Kevin is resistant. Kevin's addiction is taking a toll on his relationships and his health.

• Elizabeth and Lucy use Lucy's tarot cards and crystal ball to try and locate Alison. Lucy is hesitant, feeling like she is not doing enough to help. Elizabeth encourages Lucy to trust her instincts and keep trying. Lucy begins to feel a connection to the universe and senses that Alison is in danger.

• Joshua and Alison continue their conversation, and Alison reveals that she knows more about Joshua's past than he thought. Joshua is impressed by Alison's perceptiveness and reveals more about his childhood and his desire for love and acceptance. Alison

<summary>
• Phyllis reveals to Avery that she is pregnant and engaged to Nick, while Daniel shares his own news that he is getting married to Daisy.
• Lauren's case takes a turn as Avery negotiates a plea deal with Spencer, and Michael threatens to expose Spencer's motives and take the case to the state bar's ethics committee.
• Genevieve and Jill get into a heated argument, with Genevieve accusing Jill of being a bad mother, and Cane intervenes to break up the fight.
• Ricky's true nature is revealed as he confesses to Eden that he wrote a fake birthday card to himself and plans to bring Phyllis down using every trick in the book.</summary>

<summary>
* Genevieve and Jack discuss their upcoming wedding in Las Vegas, but Genevieve is hesitant due to some unfinished business she needs to attend to. She decides to make her own arrangements and meet Jack in Las Vegas instead of delaying the flight.
* Victor reveals to Chelsea that he hired her to seduce Billy Abbott and prove a point to his daughter, but things didn't go as planned, and Chelsea got pregnant. Victor wants Chelsea to leave town and offers her money, but Chelsea refuses.
* Victoria and Abby discuss Victoria's baby, and Victoria expresses her concerns about Chelsea changing her mind about giving up the baby. Meanwhile, Adam tries to get close to the baby, but Victoria warns him to stay away.
* Devon, Harmony, and Tucker work on Devon's new song, and Tucker reveals that he used to struggle financially as a musician. Devon is grateful for Tucker's help and impressed by his production skills.
* Phyllis and Avery discuss their father's will and the book he left for Phyllis, which Phyllis believes is a manipulative gesture. Avery disagrees, thinking that their father left the book as a reminder of his love for Phyllis.
* Nikki tries to stop Jack from marrying Genevieve, warning him that he's making a mistake and that Genevieve is not the right person for him. Jack is determined to go through with the wedding, but Nikki's words leave him uncertain.</summary>

<summary>
*Lily and Cane are on their way to a meeting, but Lily is called away to discuss a fragrance campaign with Tyler. Cane offers to stall their meeting with Chloe and Chelsea while Lily attends to the campaign. Lily promises to make it as quick as possible.

*Leslie and Neil discuss their relationship and how they feel connected. Neil senses that Leslie is hiding something and asks her to open up to him. Leslie reveals that she had a troubled past with an abusive father.

*Summer confronts Fenmore about the rumors that he pushed Jamie off a roof. Fenmore denies the allegations and accuses Summer of being selfish and vindictive. Summer tries to apologize and make amends.

*Jamie is questioned by Michael, Lauren, and Paul about the incident on the roof. Jamie accuses Fenmore of pushing him, but Fenmore denies it. Lauren is torn between believing her son and the possibility that he might be guilty.

*Tyler and Lily get stuck in an elevator, and Tyler's claustrophobia kicks in. Lily tries to calm him down by telling jokes and making up stories. Tyler eventually opens up about his past and how he developed claustrophobia.

*Chelsea meets with Cane to discuss her fashion designs, and Cane is impressed by her talent. Chelsea reveals that she taught herself to draw and design while traveling with her mother. Cane offers to help Chelsea get her designs seen by the right people.

*Fenmore and Michael have a heart-to-heart about the allegations against Fenmore. Michael tries to get Fenmore to open up and tell the truth, but Fenmore feels like his father is choosing Jamie over him. Fenmore accuses Jamie of trying to hurt him.

*Lauren is torn between believing her son and the possibility that he might be guilty. Paul tries to reassure her that they will get through this together. Lauren is worried about the consequences of Fenmore's actions.

*The episode ends with a cliffhanger as Jamie accuses Fenmore of pushing him off the roof, and Fenmore denies it. The scene ends with a dramatic confrontation between the two characters.</summary>

<summary>
• Nick is struggling to cope with the loss of his daughter Cassie and is filled with regret and guilt over the events that led to her death. He is haunted by memories of Cassie and is desperate to turn back time and make things right.
• Through a series of flashbacks and visions, Nick is shown what life would be like if he had made different choices, including keeping Cassie home the night of the party and not pushing away his wife Sharon. He sees a happier, more united family, but ultimately realizes that he cannot change the past.
• In the end, Nick comes to a realization and decides to move forward, promising Cassie's spirit that he will try to heal and move on. He returns home to his wife and son, determined to rebuild their lives together. </summary>

<summary>
* Jack and Sharon are moving out of the Abbott mansion, and Gloria is celebrating her victory with Jeff. Jack is struggling to let go of the house, but Sharon is trying to reassure him that they will make new memories in their new home.
* Alistair, the actor hired to play John Abbott's ghost, is meeting with Jill and Kay to discuss his role and how to win over Gloria. Jill and Kay are trying to help Alistair understand John's character and how to appeal to Gloria.
* Gloria is trying to get in touch with her sons, Kevin and Michael, but they are avoiding her. Kevin is planning his wedding with Jana and wants to keep Gloria at a distance.
* Adam is trying to make a good impression at Newman Enterprises, but Victoria is skeptical of his intentions. Adam is trying to prove himself as a valuable member of the team, but Victoria is not convinced.
* Phyllis is working on a new project with Nick, but they are having creative differences. Daniel and Amber are also working together, but they are having a hard time agreeing on anything.
* Victor is meeting with Sabrina in Los Angeles to discuss a potential business deal. Sabrina is showing Victor around a new art museum, and they are discussing the possibility of building a similar museum in Genoa City.
* Gloria is feeling lonely and isolated in the mansion, and she is starting to miss Jack and Sharon. She is trying to reach out to her sons, but they are not responding.
* Adam is trying to navigate his relationships with his new family members, but it's not easy. He is trying to prove himself to Victoria, but she is not making it easy for him.
* Kevin and Jana are planning their wedding, and they are considering having it at the Abbott mansion. However, Kevin is having second thoughts about involving his mother in the wedding.
* Victor is impressed by Sabrina's knowledge of art and her passion for building a new museum in Genoa City. He is considering investing in the project, but he needs to think it over carefully.
</summary>

<summary>
• Genevieve and Victor discuss their business deal, with Genevieve revealing that she has arranged for a press interview to announce the sale of Beauty of Nature. However, Victor is opposed to the idea, citing the need for S.E.C. approval before making the sale public. Genevieve is confident that the deal is aboveboard, but Victor is concerned about the source of her funding. He suspects that her ex-husband may be involved, but Genevieve denies this.

• Meanwhile, Lauren and Michael discuss their plans to retrieve Fen from Canada, with Michael assuring Lauren that they can be there tomorrow. Jill interrupts their conversation, and Lauren reveals that she has been feeling guilty about leaving Fen behind. Michael reassures her that they will get Fen back and that they will be a family again. Lauren agrees to go with Michael to Canada.

• Phyllis is struggling to cope with the loss of Lucy, and Nick tries to comfort her. Avery arrives and offers to help Daniel regain custody of Lucy, but Phyllis is skeptical. Avery explains that she did everything she could to help Daniel in court, but Phyllis is angry and blames Avery for Daisy's actions. Nick tries to calm the situation, but Phyllis is too upset.

• Devon is celebrating his newfound success with his friends and family, and they all raise a toast to his future. Devon thanks everyone for their support and reveals that he wants to take Roxanne on a romantic getaway. The group discusses possible destinations, and Neil excuses himself to make a phone call. Sofia notices that Neil seems distracted and asks if everything is okay.

• Lauren is arrested for pointing a gun at Daisy, and Jill tries to defend her actions. Michael arrives at the police station and is informed of Lauren's arrest. He is furious and blames Daisy for the situation. Avery offers to help Michael, and they both head to the police station to support Lauren. Victor is also dealing with his own problems, as he tries to navigate the S.E.C. investigation into Genevieve's purchase of Beauty of Nature.</summary>

<summary>
* Sharon is struggling with Nicholas' absence and his decision to ignore her calls, while Jack is trying to help her cope with the situation.
* Colleen is dealing with her own issues, including receiving threatening notes and phone calls that seem to be related to her father, Brad, who is being investigated by Paul and JT.
* Daniel and Kevin are trying to come up with a plan to deal with Alex, who is blackmailing them over a tape that could ruin their lives.
* Nick has returned to town and revealed that the baby Phyllis is carrying is his, but he has decided to stay with his wife Sharon and be a father to their son Noah.
* JT is investigating a cold case in Cleveland and has discovered a lead that could potentially connect to Brad's past, as a witness has identified a young Brad in a photograph from the time of the murder.</summary>

<summary>
* Kevin informs his family that he's moving to Portland with his daughter Bella, citing a need for a new start and to escape the painful memories of his past with Chloe. His family is shocked and concerned about the sudden decision, with Michael and Esther trying to persuade him to stay in Genoa City.
* Nikki returns to Genoa City after a brief absence, claiming she was at a spa in Colorado to relax and prepare for her upcoming concert. However, Nick discovers that she had a flare-up of her multiple sclerosis and is worried about her ability to perform.
* Victor is determined to make the concert a success, despite Nick's concerns about his mother's health and his own strained relationship with his father. Abby and Scott work together to prepare for the event, with Abby trying to navigate her complicated family dynamics.
* Meanwhile, Sharon declines Chelsea's offer to return to work at Chelsea 2.0, citing her busy schedule and other commitments. Chelsea is understanding but disappointed, and Sharon offers her support and encouragement as she tries to take her brand to the next level.</summary>

<summary>
* Sharon visits Nick, and they discuss the upcoming anniversary of Cassie's death, which is a difficult time for both of them. Nick is proud of Sharon for doing well with her therapy and medication. Sharon mentions that she has a strange, cloudy feeling and can't quite get close to her emotions.

* Summer's party at Phyllis' penthouse gets out of hand, and Kyle intervenes after finding Fenmore on top of Summer. Phyllis breaks up the party and calls Nick, who arrives and takes away Summer's car keys. Summer is upset and feels that her parents don't trust her.

* Michael and Lauren's marriage is struggling due to his inability to forgive her for her past infidelity with Carmine. Michael is still hurt and can't see Lauren without thinking of Carmine. Lauren is desperate to make things right and save their marriage.

* Abby confronts Carmine about his involvement with Lauren and warns him to stay away from her. Carmine is unrepentant and claims that he's not afraid of Michael. Abby is concerned about Carmine's behavior and its impact on Lauren's marriage.

* Jack tries to make amends with Phyllis after she moves out, but she's hesitant to return. Traci advises Jack to give Phyllis space and time to figure out what she wants. Jack is frustrated and feels that Traci is interfering in his relationship.

* Kyle confides in Jack about his feelings for Summer and wonders why Nick is so opposed to them being together. Jack advises Kyle to be cautious and consider the potential consequences of pursuing a relationship with Summer. Kyle is unsure but feels drawn to Summer.

* Sharon meets with Dr. Watkins and expresses her feelings of loneliness and disconnection. Dr. Watkins reassures Sharon that she's making progress and encourages her to focus on finding a sense of purpose and meaning in her life. Sharon is struggling to come to terms with her past mistakes and move forward.</summary>

<summary>
• Devon and Elena discuss their relationship issues, with Devon explaining that he paid off her student loans to help her, but Elena feeling disrespected and independent. Devon seeks advice from Mariah, who tells him that his wealth can be a factor in his relationships and that he should have respected Elena's agency.

• Kevin reveals to Michael that Chloe is alive and has been living with him in Portland, but she has been held captive by Adam, who is demanding that Kevin stay in town and help him with something in exchange for Chloe's freedom. Michael is hesitant to get involved but agrees to help Kevin.

• Adam sues Nick for custody of Christian, claiming that he wants to be a part of his son's life, but Nick is skeptical of Adam's motives and hires Michael to represent him in the custody battle. Victoria tries to apologize to Nick for giving Adam the money that he used to sue for custody.

• Elena returns to Genoa City and talks to Devon about their issues, with Devon apologizing for not respecting her boundaries and Elena forgiving him. They agree to communicate better in the future and work through their problems together.

• Kevin tries to negotiate with Adam to release Chloe, but Adam is skeptical of Kevin's claims that Phyllis is free and demands proof. Kevin is frustrated and feels that Adam is stringing him along.

• Nick warns Chelsea that Adam is back to his old ways and is suing him for custody of Christian, and that Connor may be next. Adam tells Kevin to get ready for battle, implying that things may get ugly soon.</summary>

<summary>
* Chloe has skipped her therapy session, which is a clear violation of her probation, and Kevin is trying to find her before the police do. Michael, as an officer of the court, is obligated to report Chloe's absence to Paul, but Kevin asks him to give him more time to find her. Kevin believes that Chloe needs help and that he can convince her to go to Fairview voluntarily.

* Ian Ward has been released from prison after the extortion charges against him were dropped, and he is now trying to make amends with Nikki and Dylan. However, Nikki is not interested in forgiving Ian and is still hurt by his past actions. Ian claims that he is willing to forgive Nikki for trying to send him to prison.

* Avery is filming an episode of her web series, but she is distracted by her argument with Dylan and the online comments from a user named 4mj. Austin is trying to help Avery focus on the filming, but she is too upset to continue. Avery decides to take a break and talk to Dylan about their issues.

* Kevin finds Chloe at the movies, where she has been watching a John Hughes film that reminds her of her daughter Delia. Chloe is struggling to cope with her grief and feels guilty for enjoying the movie on the night of Delia's death. Kevin tries to comfort Chloe and convince her to seek help.

* Dylan is angry with Ian for his past actions and is determined to make him pay. Avery tries to calm Dylan down and reminds him that he can't let Ian get to him. Dylan is proud of Avery for her success with her web series and is happy to support her.

* Summer is struggling to cope with her mother's illness and feels like she is losing her sense of identity. Austin tries to comfort Summer and shares his own experience of losing his mother. Summer appreciates Austin's understanding and feels a connection with him.

* Michael is worried about Kevin's involvement with Chloe and thinks that he is in over his head. Lauren tries to reassure Michael that Kevin can handle the situation, but Michael is skeptical. Michael is afraid that Kevin will get hurt if he continues to try to help Chloe.

* Victor is angry with Ian for his past actions and is determined to make him pay. Ian claims that he is innocent and that Victor is just trying to harass him. Victor warns Ian to stay away from his family, but Ian refuses to back down.</summary>

<summary>
* The Newman family is dealing with the aftermath of Victor's death, with Nick and Victoria struggling to come to terms with the loss and Nikki staying in Mexico, refusing to believe he's gone. Nikki is searching for answers about Victor's disappearance and is willing to pay for information.
* Jack is facing backlash for his comments about Victor and his decision to publish an article about him, with Sharon trying to convince him not to go through with it. Jack is also dealing with the consequences of hacking into Nick's server and is being confronted by Nick about it.
* Adam is taking over as CEO of Newman Enterprises and is making changes, including firing Neil and hiring Brad as the new CEO. Victoria is opposed to Adam's decisions and is trying to find a way to stop him from ruining the company.
* Meanwhile, Jill is dealing with the fallout from an article published in "Restless Style" that accuses her of knowing about David Chow's gambling problem and using it to her advantage. Jill is trying to find out who leaked the information and is threatening to sue Jack and the magazine.</summary>

<summary>
* Mariah tells Tessa that she wants to be with her, and Tessa reveals that she needs to leave town immediately to find her sister Crystal. Mariah decides to go with Tessa, despite having to leave her life in Genoa City behind.
* Devon and Hilary are getting married in the hospital, and Devon has planned a special ceremony to make Hilary happy. However, Hilary's health is deteriorating, and she may not have much time left.
* Phyllis and Jack discuss the wedding, and Phyllis reveals that Hilary knows her prognosis but is choosing to keep it a secret to enjoy her wedding day. Jack is upset that Devon is keeping the truth from Hilary, but Phyllis explains that Hilary wants to handle things her own way.
* Hilary's friends and family gather to give her gifts, including a heart-shaped rock from Phyllis and a joke book from Mariah. Hilary is touched by the thoughtful gifts and is grateful for the love and support of those around her.
* Lily is struggling to come to terms with her role in the accident that injured Hilary and is hesitant to attend the wedding. However, Cane convinces her to go and be part of the special day for Devon and Hilary.
* Hilary passes out before the ceremony, causing concern among her loved ones. However, she wakes up and is determined to go through with the wedding, despite her weakened state.
* Devon and Hilary exchange vows and rings, and Neil pronounces them husband and wife. The ceremony is emotional, but the couple is happy to have shared this special moment together.</summary>

<summary>
• Billy plans to fire Phyllis as the editor-in-chief of "Restless Style" due to her recent arrest, and Victoria is offered a job at the magazine. Billy also considers hiring Victoria to manage the magazine while he focuses on a new TV series.

• Ashley offers Victoria a job at Jabot, but Victoria is also considering an offer from Jack to head up Beauty of Nature. Ashley and Jack discuss their plans for their respective companies, with Ashley expressing concerns about a potential conflict of interest.

• Adam and Chelsea return from their elopement in Kansas and are excited to start their new life together. Adam shows Chelsea their new home, which features 10 bedrooms, 12 bathrooms, and a private airstrip.

• Phyllis is fired by Billy and learns that she will be featured on the cover of "Restless Style" in a negative light. Nick is upset with Billy's decision and defends Phyllis, but Billy stands by his choice.

• Nikki and Jack continue to plan their wedding, with Nikki trying on dresses and Jack meeting with investors to discuss the merger of Jabot and Beauty of Nature. Ashley confronts Jack about his actions, accusing him of trying to sway the board members' opinions.

• Victoria is torn between her job offers and seeks advice from her mother, Nikki. Nikki suggests that Victoria consider staying home with her son, Johnny, but ultimately leaves the decision up to Victoria.

• Anita returns to town and causes tension with Gloria, who is trying to determine whether Anita and Jeff are truly married. Gloria threatens to investigate and get to the bottom of the situation.

• Sharon and Victor discuss their relationship, with Sharon expressing her commitment to Victor and Victor warning her about Nikki's influence. Ashley advises Sharon to be cautious and not to get too caught up in Victor's world.

• Phyllis is advised by Avery and Nick to avoid writing a blog or speaking to the press about her situation, as it could be used against her in court. Billy is shown to be working on a story about Phyllis, with cameras capturing everything that happens in the office.</summary>

<summary>
• Lauren is worried about Daisy's hearing and its potential outcome, while Michael reassures her that he will take care of things. Lauren wants to testify against Daisy, but Michael explains that the hearing is closed to the public. Lauren is concerned that without her testimony, Daisy's parental rights might be reinstated. Phyllis is helping Daisy in exchange for her cooperation in gaining custody of Lucy.

• Phyllis visits Daisy before the hearing and tries to reassure her that everything will be okay. Daisy is nervous but determined to regain custody of her daughter. Phyllis reminds Daisy to stick to their plan and not to let her emotions get the better of her. Daisy is worried that Daniel will try to convince her to drop the case.

• The hearing begins, and Leslie questions Daisy about her past actions and her decision to give up Lucy. Daisy explains that she was in a difficult situation and didn't know what else to do. Leslie presses Daisy about her motivations and whether she is truly capable of caring for Lucy. Daisy insists that she has changed and is ready to be a mother.

• Rafe questions Phyllis about her involvement in the case and her relationship with Daisy. Phyllis claims that she is only trying to help Daisy because she believes it's the right thing to do. Rafe suggests that Phyllis is using Daisy to get custody of Lucy for her own son. Phyllis denies this and insists that she is acting in Lucy's best interests.

• Meanwhile, Victor is dealing with the aftermath of his company's IPO, which is going well. However, he is interrupted by Diane, who claims to be pregnant with his child. Victor is skeptical but agrees to support her until the paternity can be confirmed. Diane's condition suddenly worsens, and she is rushed to the hospital.

• Adam is working on a plan to sabotage Victor's company and is in contact with a mysterious woman who is helping him. Adam sends a tip to a news outlet about Victor's condition, which causes the stock price to plummet. Jack Abbott is also trying to take advantage of the situation and is working with a woman named Genevieve to make a profit.

• The hearing continues, with Daniel testifying against Daisy and Phyllis trying to defend her. The judge takes a recess, and Phyllis tells Leslie to do whatever it takes to salvage the case. Meanwhile, Victor's condition is revealed to be a stroke, and the news causes chaos in the business world. The judge returns and is about to make

<summary>
* John Abbott is having trouble with his vision and is taken to the hospital, where he is given a series of tests. The nurse cannot tell Jack what kind of tests are being run, but Dr. Campbell is with John and will provide an update soon.
* Gloria is worried and wants to see John, but Jack is skeptical of her concern. Gloria remembers a romantic evening with John and how much she misses him.
* Ashley is worried that John's stroke may be related to his heart or that he may have been assaulted in prison. Jack is skeptical, but Ashley thinks it's possible that someone in prison may have attacked John because of his potential sentence commutation.
* Dr. Campbell updates the family on John's condition, saying he had a minor stroke and is being given thrombolytic medication to dissolve any blood clots. John is conscious and able to have visitors, but only one at a time.
* Gloria visits John and is relieved to see him sitting up and filling out forms. John is making jokes and seems fine, but Gloria is still worried about his condition.
* Lily is struggling to cope with her parents' constant arguing and feels like she's suffocating in the house. She decides to leave and clear her head, but her parents are worried about her and think she may have gone back to Daniel.
* Daniel is filling in for Kevin at the coffeehouse and is surprised to see Lily walk in. Lily is upset and feels like she has no one to talk to or trust, but Daniel listens to her and tries to offer support.
* Neil and Dru argue about how to handle Lily's situation, with Neil wanting to push her to make decisions and Dru wanting to give her space. Neil accuses Dru of being manipulative and self-serving, and Dru accuses Neil of being self-righteous and never making mistakes.
* The argument escalates, with Neil saying he's done with the marriage and Dru saying she's done being crucified for her mistakes. Neil says he agrees with Dru that it's time to look at the future and make serious changes.
* The scene ends with a code blue being called for John's room, and the family rushes to his side in a state of panic. The doctor's update on John's condition is left unknown, leaving the audience in suspense.</summary>

<summary>
* The scene opens with Murphy gathering Katherine's loved ones to deliver her instructions from beyond the grave. Katherine's letter asks everyone to write down their thoughts, hopes, and dreams, and then burn the letters, allowing the smoke to deliver their words to her. The group is initially skeptical but eventually warms up to the idea. As they write their letters, they reflect on their lives and relationships.

* Meanwhile, Victoria is trying to balance her health and her desire to attend her son Johnny's preschool orientation. Billy helps her escape from the hospital, and they share a heartwarming moment as they watch Johnny interact with his teacher. Victoria is grateful for Billy's support, and they bond over their shared experiences as parents. Billy promises to be there for Johnny's future milestones.

* As the group gathers to burn their letters, they share their thoughts and feelings about Katherine and their lives. Neil, who has recently gone blind, is struggling to come to terms with his new reality. Devon and Hilary offer their support, and the group comes together to celebrate Katherine's life. The ceremony ends with a party, and the group dances and reminisces about Katherine.

* As the party winds down, Jill has a moment of realization about the music box Katherine left her. She understands that the journey, not the destination, was the true treasure. Jill is grateful to Katherine for bringing her and Colin together again. The episode ends with Jill returning the music box to Katherine, symbolizing her newfound appreciation for the journey. The scene also sets up future storylines, including Victor's plans to revive Phyllis from her coma and Nikki's struggles with her health and relationships.</summary>

<summary>
* Billy Abbott attends an art show featuring Daniel Romalotti's work, where he meets Amber Moore, who is being drawn by Daniel. Billy is immediately drawn to Amber and they start talking, while Daniel is uncomfortable with Billy's presence. Billy and Amber leave the art show together, heading to a bar for a drink.

* Jill Abbott receives good news that the S.E.C. has ruled in her favor, clearing her of any wrongdoing in the Jabot stock price manipulation case. She is ecstatic and decides to celebrate by sharing the news with her family. Jill visits her son Cane and shows him the good news, and they discuss their plans for Chancellor Industries.

* River Baldwin, a fugitive, is arrested and taken into custody, where he meets with his lawyer, Michael Baldwin. River explains that he has been on the run for 40 years and has a daughter, Eden, who is now in Michael's care. Michael is skeptical of River's story and warns him that the charges against him are serious.

* Colleen Carlton and Daniel Romalotti grow closer as they talk about their feelings for each other. Colleen confesses that she has feelings for Daniel, and he reveals that he sees her as more than just a friend. Meanwhile, Billy and Amber continue to flirt and get to know each other at the bar.

* Eden Baldwin, River's daughter, is struggling to come to terms with her father's arrest and the fact that she may have to live with Michael, a man she doesn't know. Michael tries to reassure her that he will do everything he can to help her father, but Eden is skeptical. Michael eventually convinces Eden to stay with him and Lauren, promising to do everything he can to help her father.</summary>

<summary>
• Hilary and Devon are hosting a Christmas Eve party at their new penthouse, where they announce that Hilary will be returning to the GC Buzz as host and executive producer.
• Billy visits his sisters Ashley and Traci on Christmas Eve, bringing gifts and sharing a warm moment together, but is met with hostility by their brother Jack when he arrives.
• Phyllis reveals to Lauren that she is ready to leave Jabot and is interested in working for Fenmore's, and the two come to an agreement for Phyllis to join the company.
• Gloria returns to Genoa City and is welcomed by her family, but her disapproval of Chloe and Kevin's relationship causes tension, while Bella's kindness helps to ease the situation.
• Lily confronts Devon about Hilary's return to the GC Buzz, revealing that Hilary's job offers were a ploy to manipulate Devon into giving her what she wanted.</summary>

<summary>
• Billy and Victoria discuss her not feeling well, and Billy suspects she might be pregnant with morning sickness.
• Kevin and Chloe take Delia to a Christmas tree lot for a photo shoot, where they meet a photographer named Nika.
• Cane meets with Sofia to discuss a new assignment, and Sofia mentions that Tucker is doing a background check on Blake.
• Phyllis and Daniel discuss Daisy's pregnancy, and Daniel expresses his concerns about the baby's well-being.
• Chloe and Kevin take a series of silly Christmas photos, which they plan to use for their Christmas card.
• Victoria reveals to Chloe that she might be pregnant, and Chloe is surprised by the news.
• Kevin visits Daisy and offers to raise her baby, but Phyllis objects to the idea.
• Cane and Lily decorate their Christmas tree with Sofia's help, and Cane expresses his desire for his family to be healthy and happy.

<summary>
